0.title: AIIMS Delhi to implement eCasualty, eICU for remote monitoring
0.article_body: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Delhi has decided to implement eCasualty and eICU charting solutions so as to enable central and remote monitoring of patient care devices, according to AIIMS officials. The move, which is for all red and yellow area beds in emergency rooms and ICU area beds, will come into effect from April 1 next year.

1.title: Teachers hired at Punjab govt school after students block national highway for 2 hrs
1.article_body: After students of a government school blocked a national highway for nearly two hours demanding the recruitment of science teachers in their school in Punjab's Moga, four private teachers were hired on a temporary basis. The teachers were hired after AAP MLA for Bagha Purana, Amritpal Singh Sukhanand, said that he will pay the salaries from his own pocket.

2.title: PM Modi lays foundation stone of projects worth over ₹10,500 cr in Visakhapatnam
2.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday laid the foundation stone of projects worth over ₹10,500 crore in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. He laid the foundation stone of a dedicated Port Road from Convent Junction to Sheela Nagar Junction in the city. Besides that, the Prime Minister also laid the foundation stone of a section of the six-lane Greenfield Raipur-Visakhapatnam Economic Corridor.

3.title: Eli Lilly loses $15 billion in market cap after tweet by fake account with $8 blue tick
3.article_body: Pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly lost over $15 billion in market cap because of a tweet by a fake Eli Lilly account verified with a $8 blue tick. "We're excited to announce insulin is now free," the fake account had tweeted. "We apologise to those who have been served a misleading message from a fake Lilly account," the company tweeted.

4.title: I don't want to see non-performing seniors in the next World Cup: Sehwag
4.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said he doesn't want to see "some non-performing seniors" from India's 2022 T20 World Cup squad in the next World Cup. "It happened in 2007 T20 World Cup also...stalwarts didn't go...a bunch of youngsters went [and won]," he added. "If they go...with the same team...result will also be the same," Sehwag further said.

5.title: Trek was difficult as terrain was tough, it was cold: Anupam Kher on 'Uunchai'
5.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher said that the trek during the shoot of the movie 'Uunchai' was difficult. "I hail from a mountainous region, thus I enjoyed trekking and loved every moment of it. It was difficult as it was tough terrain and it was cold enough to climb up and down the mountains," he added.

6.title: Alibaba opts not to disclose Singles' Day sales tally for 1st time since 2009
6.article_body: Alibaba Group kept the final sales tally of its annual Singles' Day shopping festival undisclosed for the first time since it started the event in 2009. However, it said the results were in line with last year. It said the event had "delivered results in line with last year's GMV performance despite macro challenges and COVID-19-related impact".

7.title: Burqa-clad women steal gold earrings worth over ₹1.5 lakh in Pune
7.article_body: An FIR was lodged on Thursday after a shop owner in Pune alleged that two unidentified burqa-clad women stole gold earrings worth ₹1.65 lakh from his jewellery shop in October. Police said the complainant and his staff members learned of the robbery when they were preparing an inventory of the ornaments. They checked CCTV footage and later approached the police.

8.title: Vote for the 'prosperous future' of Himachal Pradesh: Rahul Gandhi
8.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi appealed to the citizens of Himachal Pradesh to vote in large numbers and to vote for the "prosperous future" of the state. "Himachal will vote for [the] OPS (old pension scheme). Himachal will vote for employment. Himachal will vote for 'Har Ghar Laxmi'…make your valuable contribution for the progress…of Himachal," said Rahul.

9.title: World's highest polling booth at 15,200 ft set up in Himachal for 52 voters
9.article_body: Election Commission has set up the world's highest polling booth at Tashigang in the Lahaul and Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh. Sharing a clip of the booth situated at 15,256 ft, CEO Himachal said it has 52 registered voters. "It has been made a model polling station to make voting easy for senior citizens and disabled voters," CEO added.

10.title: It's just a small chunk of flesh: Lalu Yadav's daughter on donating kidney
10.article_body: Rohini Acharya, RJD President Lalu Prasad's Singapore-based daughter took to Twitter to write about her decision of donating her kidney to her father. "It is just a small chunk of flesh that I wish to give away to my father...Please pray that things turn out well and Papa is fit again to give voice to you all," she wrote.

11.title: Thomson Reuters to buy tax software provider SurePrep for $500 mn
11.article_body: Thomson Reuters on Friday announced that it will acquire California-based SurePrep for $500 million in cash. Founded in 2002, SurePrep is a provider of tax automation software and services. It is expected to generate around $60 million in revenue this year and grow in excess of 20% annually in the next few years, Thomson Reuters said in a statement.

12.title: 800 people test positive for COVID-19 on cruise ship in Australia
12.article_body: Around 800 people have tested COVID-19 positive on a cruise ship carrying a total of 4,600 passengers and crew in Australia. Marguerite Fitzgerald, the President of cruise operator Carnival Australia, said a large number of cases started to be detected about halfway through the 12-day voyage. All cases were either asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic, she said.

13.title: Over 200 candidates in Himachal Assembly polls are crorepatis: ADR
13.article_body: Out of the 412 candidates contesting the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, 226 are crorepatis, Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) said. The average assets of candidates are valued at ₹4.65 crore. ADR claimed that 61 out of the 68 candidates fielded by Congress and 56 out of the 68 candidates fielded by BJP have declared assets valued at over ₹1 crore.

14.title: Man found unfit for central forces over 'religious tattoo' moves HC
14.article_body: A man has approached Delhi High Court after he was declared unfit for recruitment into Central Armed Police Forces and other forces for having a "religious tattoo" on his right arm. The man told the court that he was willing to remove the tattoo. The court has allowed the man to appear before a new medical board after removing tattoo.

15.title: UK summons Iran's top diplomat over threats to British-Iranian journalists
15.article_body: UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly summoned the Iranian Chargé d’Affaires over alleged death threats to Iranian journalists living in the UK. London-based Volant Media, which operates Iran International TV, said two of its British-Iranian journalists had received "credible death threats" from Iranian security. The UK earlier sanctioned Iran's morality police over crackdown on protesters.

16.title: End corruption to restore Bengaluru's former glory: Siddaramaiah to PM Modi
16.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah accused the BJP government in Karnataka of involving itself in corrupt practices and urged PM Modi to end corruption to restore Bengaluru's former glory. "You have to answer for derailing the vision that Kempegowda had. [PM Modi] if you really want to respect Kempegowda and his values, [then] end this 40% corruption," said Siddaramaiah.

17.title: India reports 833 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 12,553
17.article_body: India reported 833 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of active cases in India stands at 12,553. According to the ministry data, the death toll has reached 5,30,528. The recovery rate has increased to 98.78 per cent.

18.title: TikTok CEO blamed staff for sales slump while spending money on parties: Report
18.article_body: TikTok cut its global ad revenue target for 2022 by $2 billion to $10 billion, Bloomberg reported. This move came after TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew blamed employees for underperforming while the company spent on "inflated salaries" and lavish parties, Financial Times cited sources as saying. In September, Chew had called out employees for falling sales in e-commerce and advertising.

19.title: 11 kids collapse at school after trying to contact the dead using Ouija board in Colombia
19.article_body: Eleven children were found collapsed at a school in Colombia after using an Ouija board to contact the dead. The teenagers, who were suffering from violent vomiting, said they drank water from the same glass. The medical report said it was due to food poisoning, however, the mayor said, "It is not ruled out that it was the Ouija board."

20.title: What does India's removal from US' currency monitoring list mean?
20.article_body: The US has removed India and four other nations from its currency monitoring list. The list consists of nations that US considers as 'currency manipulators' who engage in unfair currency practices for a trade advantage. The removal means the RBI can now take robust measures to manage the exchange rates effectively without being tagged a currency manipulator, an expert said.

21.title: Mumbai reports 61 cases of dengue in first 6 days of Nov, tally rises to 905
21.article_body: The BMC has confirmed that 61 cases of dengue have been reported in Mumbai in the first six days of November. The civic body is sending teams to the spots where cases are on the rise and is taking immediate remedial measures. A total of 905 dengue cases have been reported since January this year.

22.title: 61-year-old Suniel Shetty used prosthetics to look over 60 in 'Dharavi Bank'
22.article_body: The team of actor Suniel Shetty, who'll be seen playing the role of Thalaivan in series 'Dharavi Bank', had to use prosthetics to make his character look over 60. "We had to make Anna age himself because he is so fit that nobody would believe he is playing a 63-year-old without prosthetics," director Samit Kakkad said about the 61-year-old actor.

23.title: Bengaluru witnesses chilly weather, temperature drops to 20° Celsius
23.article_body: Bengaluru on Saturday witnessed chilly weather with the temperature hovering around  20° Celsius in all major zones. Most of Bengaluru's wards had a temperature between 19.24 and 19.88 degrees Celsius, with a few having temperatures between 18.6 and 19.24 degrees Celsius. Light rain is expected in the west zone tomorrow, Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre (KSNDMC) said.

24.title: 79-year-old man cheated of ₹17 lakh in dating app scam in Pune
24.article_body: A 79-year-old Pune resident was allegedly cheated of ₹17.10 lakh by an unidentified person between December 2021 and June 2022. The complainant alleged that he had received a call wherein a female voice said he would be introduced to a woman through an online dating application. He was sent a picture of a woman and asked to pay money.

25.title: School bus overturns in Maharashtra; 8 including students injured
25.article_body: At least eight people, including school students, were injured after a school bus overturned near Gharoshiwadi off Raigad-Mangaon road in Maharashtra on Friday, a police official said. There were 32 people on board the bus, which was returning from Raigad Fort, the police official added. "The cause of the accident is not known," the police official further said.

26.title: New damage to Nova Kakhovka dam near Kherson after Russian retreat
26.article_body: US satellite imagery company Maxar has said that there has been significant new damage to Nova Kakhovka dam in southern Ukraine following Russia's withdrawal from Kherson located nearby. It added that sections of the northern extent of the dam and sluice gates had been "deliberately destroyed". Russia and Ukraine accused each other of planning to damage the dam using explosives.

27.title: Prayagraj railway station gets certified as 'Eat Right Station', 1st in UP
27.article_body: Prayagraj Junction has become the first railway station in Uttar Pradesh to be certified as an 'Eat Right Station' by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI), railway officials said. The certification is awarded to stations adhering to standard food storage and hygiene practices. Prayagraj Junction was certified after training at all levels and a thorough third-party audit.

28.title: Trump sues House committee investigating Jan 6 attack to avoid testifying before it
28.article_body: Donald Trump is suing the US House committee investigating the January 6 Capitol attack to block a subpoena requiring him to testify. "Long-held precedent and practice maintain that separation of powers prohibits Congress from compelling a President to testify before it," his attorney said. Panel members allege Trump "personally orchestrated" a multi-part effort to overturn 2020 election results.

29.title: US-based firm Kyte raises $60 mn in round led by InterAlpen Partners
29.article_body: US-based on-demand car rental company Kyte has secured $60 million in Series B funding round led by InterAlpen Partners, whose founder, Stephen George, was an early investor in Tesla and SpaceX. The funding round also saw participation from Valor Equity Partners, Anthemis Group, Citi Ventures, Hearst Ventures and DN Capital, among others. In March, the company raised $200 million.

30.title: 3-day salary of over 300 Panchkula staffers cut for not wearing smartwatches
30.article_body: Three-day salary of over 300 Panchkula workers associated with the municipal corporation was deducted for allegedly not wearing smartwatches when the city Mayor Kulbhushan Goyal inspected the attendance system. The Mayor had earlier directed to not release their salaries but later ordered the release with a three-day cut. GPS-installed smartwatches have been given to workers to mark attendance.

31.title: Walt Disney plans to freeze hiring, cut some jobs: Report
31.article_body: Walt Disney is planning to freeze hiring and cut some jobs to manage costs, Reuters said citing a memo sent by CEO Bob Chapek. "Hiring for the small subset of most critical...positions will continue," Chapek said. He added that business travel should be limited to only essential trips and meetings should be conducted virtually as much as possible.

32.title: Estee Lauder nearing deal to acquire Tom Ford for $2.8 bn: Report
32.article_body: Cosmetics company Estee Lauder is nearing a deal to buy luxury brand Tom Ford for about $2.8 billion, the Financial Times reported citing sources. The deal, which includes debt, could reportedly be announced as early as Monday. Notably, Estee had taken full control of Canadian beauty group Deciem for about $1 billion in 2021, according to the FT report.

33.title: Indonesia's largest internet firm GoTo plans to cut over 1,000 jobs: Report
33.article_body: Indonesia's largest internet company GoTo is planning to cut more than 1,000 jobs, 10% of its workforce, to trim costs, Bloomberg reported. The job cuts will reportedly affect employees in all divisions. GoTo may announce job cuts in the coming weeks and the size of the reduction may change. The company had 9,630 permanent employees at the end of June.

34.title: $1 billion of customer funds vanish from failed crypto exchange FTX: Report
34.article_body: At least $1 billion of customer funds have vanished from failed crypto exchange FTX, according to a Reuters report quoting two people familiar with the matter. The exchange's former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried secretly transferred $10 billion of customer funds from FTX to Bankman-Fried's trading company Alameda Research, the people told Reuters. FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday.

35.title: 2 railway staffers run over by train while working on track in H'yana
35.article_body: Two railway employees, aged 37 and 45, died after they were run over by a speeding train while they were working on a track in Haryana's Panipat. The incident took place when the duo jumped to another track when they noticed a train coming towards them, however, another train was also coming on the other track, the police said.

36.title: It's been a very emotional campaign: Pak mentor Hayden ahead of T20 WC final
36.article_body: Pakistan mentor Matthew Hayden has said their campaign in the ongoing T20 World Cup has been "very emotional" and the "highs" have been excellent. "When it comes to huge tournaments, we know what it means...it means the opportunity to set nations alight and alive again," he added. Pakistan reached the final despite defeats against India and Zimbabwe in group stage.

37.title: Create a new record of voting: PM Modi appeals to Himachal Pradesh voters
37.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi appealed to the citizens of Himachal Pradesh to participate in the election process and create a new record of voting. He greeted the youth, who will be voting for the first time. "Today is the polling day for all the Assembly seats in Himachal Pradesh...participate with full enthusiasm in this festival of democracy," said the PM.

38.title: Ad firm Omnicom suggests clients to pause Twitter ad spend: Reports
38.article_body: Major ad firm Omnicom Group has suggested its clients to pause ad spending on Twitter in the short term, according to an internal memo. "Twitter's ability to maintain their previous level of brand safety measures and effectiveness [seems] impeded in the immediate term," the memo read. Omnicom, which serves over 5,000 clients, represents brands like McDonald's, Apple and PepsiCo.

39.title: Meta to shut down smart display unit, smartwatch projects: Reports
39.article_body: Meta is reportedly shutting down its smart display business Portal and will also wind down work on its two smartwatch projects. According to The Verge, Meta already decided to stop producing Portal devices for consumers in June but is now planning to stop selling them to businesses as well. Meanwhile, the two smartwatches were reportedly in early-stage and middle-stage development.

40.title: 60-year-old killed after school bus rams into his bike in Mumbai
40.article_body: A 60-year-old man, Jamil Ahmed, died in Mumbai's Govandi area after a school bus rammed into his bike on Thursday. According to the police, the deceased was coming back from a fish market when the incident took place. He was taken to the hospital, however, he was declared dead before arrival and his body was sent for a post-mortem.

41.title: Indian fast bowlers drop pace post IPL: Wasim Akram
41.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram has said that India's pacers are dropping pace after the IPL season. "For instance, Avesh Khan was bowling consistently at 145 kmph but after one season of IPL...the pace drops to 130-135 kmph," added Akram. "BCCI needs to check the reason behind that because Avesh got paid some 12-13 crore Indian money," he further said.

42.title: Multiple layers of protection keeps your privacy protected: WhatsApp
42.article_body: WhatsApp introduced new built-in privacy features of protection like online presence, leave groups silently, screenshot blocking for view once couple of months ago. These multiple new features along with existing features like end-to-end encryption, two-step verification, and encrypted backups collectively offers users control over their privacy needs.

43.title: Actor Kevin Conroy, best known for voicing Batman, passes away aged 66
43.article_body: Actor Kevin Conroy, best known for voicing Batman on Warner Bros' long-running TV show 'Batman: The Animated Series', passed away aged 66 after battling cancer. Kevin had begun his career in the 1980s as a live-action actor. "Kevin was perfection. He was one of my favorite people on the planet," said Mark Hamill, who voiced Joker, while condoling Kevin's demise.

44.title: Pic of Banksy's artwork on damaged Ukrainian building goes viral
44.article_body: Banksy has shared a picture of his artwork on the side of a damaged building in Ukraine amid war. The artwork shows a female gymnast balancing on the damaged building. This comes amid speculation that the anonymous graffiti artist has been on a visit to the country after a series of murals appeared in the Ukrainian town of Borodyanka.

45.title: Drummer takes Elon Musk to court over $56-billion Tesla package
45.article_body: A heavy metal drummer sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk for $56 billion and the billionaire is set to square it off in court next week. In 2018, drummer Richard Tornetta held just nine shares when he sued Musk after taking offence at the world's richest man taking a $56 billion pay package at Tesla after becoming its CEO.

46.title: 38 Indians working as bonded labourers at factory in Nepal rescued
46.article_body: Nepalese authorities have rescued at least 38 Indian nationals from a brick factory in Rautahat where they were working as bonded labourers, police said on Friday. All the rescued people, which included 20 men and 18 women and children, hail from Uttar Pradesh. The people were handed over to Sashastra Seema Bal in Bihar, a police spokesperson said.

47.title: ED raids granite firms in Hyderabad & Karimnagar, unearths over ₹1 crore
47.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate conducted searches at the offices and residential premises of various granite firms in Karimnagar and Hyderabad, uncovering unaccounted cash worth ₹1.08 crore. "[Firms] are exporting rough granite blocks to China, Hong Kong SAR and other countries," ED said in an official statement. It also seized voluminous granite dispatch data for the last 10 years.

48.title: Entire $16 billion wealth of FTX ex-CEO Bankman-Fried wiped out in days
48.article_body: The entire $16 billion fortune of former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has been wiped out. The 30-year-old was worth almost $16 billion at the start of the week. FTX, which filed for bankruptcy, on Friday said that Bankman-Fried has resigned as Chief Executive Officer and will be succeeded by John J Ray III.

49.title: Mom, dad would be proud of how we've brought up our kids: SRK on late parents
49.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said that his late parents would be proud of how he and wife Gauri Khan have been able to bring up their three children, Suhana, Aryan and AbRam. He said they will be very happy about his achievement. He also spoke about how his mother would say that he has become thin.

50.title: Bank of Baroda cuts home loan rates by 25 basis points to 8.25%
50.article_body: Bank of Baroda (BoB) lowered home loan rates by 25 basis points to 8.25% and waived the processing fee under a limited-period offer. The new rates will come into effect on November 14 and will be applicable till December end. These will be applicable for those seeking balance transfers and the special rate is linked to the borrower's credit profile.

51.title: 'How does our President look,' says TMC minister; BJP condemns him
51.article_body: TMC minister Akhil Giri has invited criticism from BJP after he commented on President Droupadi Murmu's looks. "He (Suvendu Adhikari) said that I am not good-looking...We don't judge anyone by their appearance...We respect the office of the President...But how does our President look?" he said. BJP's Bengal unit said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and TMC are anti-tribal.

52.title: Rape accused who hit security guard with car in Noida arrested
52.article_body: A rape accused was arrested from his workplace in Gurugram days after he hit a security guard of a housing society in Noida to escape. "An attempt was made to stop him when the accused struck the security in-charge...with the intention of killing him," police said. Police said he may not have expected to be arrested in a different jurisdiction.

53.title: 4 men try to rob 89-yr-old Thane man of ₹5000, tie his caretaker; 1 held
53.article_body: One person has been arrested while the police are on a lookout for three more after the four allegedly tried to rob an 89-year-old man of ₹5000 in Thane. Reports said that the four entered the man's house and tied up his caretaker. One of the men was wearing a food delivery company's dress, reports added.

54.title: 72-yr-old woman locked up, assaulted by sons & their wives in Gurugram
54.article_body: A 72-year-old woman suffered multiple fractures after she was allegedly assaulted by her two sons and their wives last month. All the suspects have been arrested, police said. They allegedly locked her inside a room and she managed to escape when a tenant unlocked the door. A relative claimed the accused wanted money she had in her bank account.

55.title: PMC & PCMC mandate registration of pet cats, to charge ₹50/pet
55.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Friday passed a resolution mandating the registration of pet cats and have launched an online facility where this can be done at ₹50/pet. Moreover, a PMC health officer said, "Though it's estimated that there are around 0.1 million pet dogs within civic limits, hardly 5,000 are registered with PMC."

56.title: Murder accused jumps from balcony of courthouse, dies in Faridabad
56.article_body: A man, who was accused of murdering his 19-year-old girlfriend, died by suicide on Friday after he pushed police personnel and advocates aside, ran to the balcony and jumped from sixth floor of the courthouse, police said. The incident occurred while a magistrate was hearing the accused's case. According to police, the accused suspected his girlfriend was having an affair.

57.title: Woman gets her 28-yr-old boyfriend married to her 15-yr-old daughter in Pune; arrested
57.article_body: A woman and her 28-year-old lover have been arrested after she allegedly forced her 15-year-old daughter to marry him in Maharashtra's Pune. The 36-year-old woman also allegedly forced her to have sexual relations with him, a police officer said. "The woman told the girl she would commit suicide if the latter did not agree to the marriage," the officer added.

58.title: We are happy to have India get that bargain: US on Russia oil sales
58.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has said, "Russian oil is going to be selling at bargain prices and we're happy to have India get that bargain or Africa or China. It's fine." Yellen further said that India and private Indian oil companies "can also purchase oil at any price they want as long as they don't use Western services".

59.title: Report says Tesla may export China-made EVs to US, Musk calls it false
59.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said a Reuters report saying Tesla is considering exporting China-made electric cars to the US is false. The report said Tesla is seeing if parts made by its China-based suppliers are compliant with local regulations in North America. If compliant, Tesla could ship China-made cars for sale there as soon as 2023, it added.

60.title: Voting begins for 68 Assembly seats in Himachal Pradesh
60.article_body: Voting for 68 Assembly seats in Himachal Pradesh began at 8 am on Saturday. State Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur is contesting from the Seraj constituency. He will be contesting against Congress' Chetram Thakur. Other key constituencies include Haroli, Nadaun, Dalhousie and Darang. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has requested voters across the state to participate in the polls today.

61.title: Nearly half of 11,000 roles eliminated by Meta were in tech
61.article_body: Meta has told its employees that nearly half of the 11,000 jobs it eliminated this week were technology roles. HR head Lori Goler noted around 54% of those laid off were in business positions and the rest were in technology roles. Employees were also told that Meta would stop developing smart displays and smartwatches, Reuters said citing a meeting.

62.title: Vatican to probe French cardinal who sexually abused minor girl
62.article_body: The Vatican will launch an investigation into French Cardinal Jean-Pierre Ricard, who has admitted to sexually assaulting a 14-year-old girl decades ago. The probe will be carried out by a person with the "necessary autonomy, impartiality and experience", the Vatican said on Friday. The Vatican reportedly seeks to use the findings by French authorities as information in its own investigation.

63.title: Maha logs 169 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; active cases at 1,169
63.article_body: Maharashtra recorded 169 new cases of COVID-19 along with two deaths due to the infection in the last 24 hours, a health official informed on Friday. Raigad and Akola districts logged one fatality each, the official said. Out of the fresh cases, 41, the maximum, were reported from the state capital, Mumbai. Maharashtra's active case count now stands at 1,169.

64.title: 'The Scream' painting targeted by climate activists in Norway museum
64.article_body: Two climate activists tried in vain to glue themselves to acclaimed painter Edvard Munch's 1893 masterpiece 'The Scream' at the National Museum of Norway on Friday, Norwegian Police said. The painting, which was on display with a glass cover, was not harmed. Police said after they were alerted by the museum officials, three people were brought under their "control".

65.title: Subhas Chandra Bose was first PM of undivided India: Rajnath Singh
65.article_body: Subhas Chandra Bose was the first Prime Minister of undivided India, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh claimed on Friday. He said Bose formed India's first swadeshi government, Azad Hind sarkar, and took oath as Prime Minister on October 21, 1943. The Azad Hind sarkar was not a symbolic government, Singh said, adding, "[It] had its own...currency and a secret intelligence service."

66.title: Woman, girl thrashed while resisting robbery at gunpoint in Punjab
66.article_body: A video showing a man attacking a woman and robbing her at gunpoint in Punjab's Tarn Taran has surfaced online. A schoolgirl, who was purportedly seen standing beside the victim, was slapped by the accused when she tried to intervene. The accused managed to snatch a piece of jewellery from the neck of the woman after thrashing her multiple times.

67.title: Brazil favourites to win FIFA WC 2022 in Qatar: Reuters poll
67.article_body: Brazil are tipped to clinch the FIFA World Cup 2022 trophy in Qatar, according to a poll conducted by Reuters. The poll stated that 46% of the respondents favoured Brazil to win the WC while Argentina (15%) and France (14%) were placed at the second and third positions, respectively. The poll last successfully predicted the champions during the 2010 WC.

68.title: SoftBank to write down $100 billion FTX investment to zero: Report
68.article_body: SoftBank Vision Fund will write down its investments in Sam Bankman-Fried's cryptocurrency exchange FTX to zero, Reuters reported citing a source close to SoftBank. SoftBank CFO Yoshimitsu Goto disclosed a $100 billion investment in FTX and described it as a minor stake in the company. FTX Group on Friday said it has filed for bankruptcy in US.

69.title: Punjab govt announces paid holiday for voters of Himachal on Sat
69.article_body: The Punjab government has announced a special holiday on Saturday for employees who are voters of Himachal Pradesh. State government employees can avail the paid holiday by presenting a voter card to the authority. An official said the holiday is for all voters of Himachal who are working in any business, trade, industrial undertaking or any other establishment in Punjab.

70.title: 5 weddings delayed as rainwater floods Chennai temple
70.article_body: Five weddings scheduled at Chennai's Anjineyar temple were delayed on Friday after the temple got flooded due to heavy rainfall. A video showed a bride and a groom holding an umbrella and wading through a waterlogged road to reach the temple. "I appeal to the government to...clear the rainwater from the temple and other public places," the groom said.

71.title: Argentina announce their 26-man squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup, Lionel Messi to lead
71.article_body: Argentina today announced their 2022 FIFA World Cup squad. Lionel Messi, who'll be featuring in his fifth World Cup, will captain the 26-man squad. Forward Paulo Dybala, who has been out of action due to a hamstring injury since October, has been included in the squad. Out of the 26 players, 21 were part of Argentina's 2021 Copa America victory.

72.title: Man tries to use 'shortcut' by crossing from under a train in Bihar, it starts moving
72.article_body: A video from Bhagalpur, Bihar shows a man lying under a moving train, trying to save himself. He was trying to cross over to a different platform from under the train as a 'shortcut'. However, it started moving and he was trapped under it. The man managed to escape unhurt. Many social media users demanded the man's arrest.

73.title: F1 sprint races are not fun, prefer the old qualification: Verstappen
73.article_body: Current F1 world champion Max Verstappen said he is not a big fan of sprint races as he feels they're not much fun. "I feel like we don't really race...you can't really risk it because the main race is where you really get the points," said Verstappen. The Red Bull driver added that he prefers the current method of qualification.

74.title: Mick Schumacher should forget F1, his name is his biggest burden: Ecclestone
74.article_body: Former F1 CEO Bernie Ecclestone said there is little hope of Haas driver Mick Schumacher staying in the sport for the upcoming season. "Maybe he has to forget Formula One and focus on other motorsport series. His name is his biggest burden," said Ecclestone. He added that people around Mick need to have a positive and non-critical outlook towards him.

75.title: Reopen 1-year-old cases of all unnatural deaths: Assam CM to police
75.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Friday he has directed the police to re-examine all unnatural death cases in the state in the past year. Sarma said he made the decision following the recent arrests of a magistrate, a superintendent of police and government doctors in Darrang district. The arrested officials allegedly protected an accused in a murder case.

76.title: Jet Airways Q2 loss widens to over ₹308 cr, revenue down 70%
76.article_body: Delhi-based Jet Airways' net loss widened to ₹308.24 crore for the July-September quarter as against a loss of ₹305.76 crore in the same quarter last year. Jet Airways saw its total revenue decline by nearly 70% to ₹12.45 crore from ₹41.02 crore in the year-ago period. The aviation company's total expenses rose to ₹321.76 crore in the quarter.

77.title: India need to keep an eye on strike rate going forward: Chopra
77.article_body: Former India spinner Nikhil Chopra said that India need to keep an eye on their strike rate in their future T20I matches. "You have just 120 balls...You have to see how many batsmen are playing how many deliveries and at what strike rate. And you have to figure out...your wicket-taking options," Chopra, who played 39 ODI matches, said.

78.title: I'm the best coach on the face of the earth: Spain's Luis Enrique
78.article_body: Spain manager Luis Enrique said he's "the best coach on the face of the earth" as he announced the squad for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. "There is no better coach than me. I know it's not true, but I believe it," said Enrique. Spain will resume training on Monday before their opening match against Costa Rica on November 23.

79.title: I am too confident that Brazil will win the 2022 FIFA World Cup: Pele
79.article_body: Three-time World Cup-winning forward Pele said he believes Brazil will be crowned champions for a sixth time in Qatar next month. "You may even think that I am too confident, but I feel that we will see Brazil win again," said the 82-year-old. Brazil have had an undefeated World Cup qualifying campaign to finish first in South America.

80.title: Govt working to ensure equal rights, opportunities for all: J&K LG
80.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said the government is working to ensure equal rights and opportunities for all with participation of every stakeholder in its development. "Jammu and Kashmir will progress, when our farmers prosper," Sinha said. "Dr Mangala Rai-led Apex Committee on Agriculture provides a comprehensive solution for upliftment of the farming community," he added.

81.title: 11 RSS workers in Kerala convicted in 2013 murder case
81.article_body: A court in Kerala's capital Thiruvananthapuram on Friday convicted 11 RSS workers for the 2013 murder of Anavoor Narayanan Nair. The quantum of punishment will be pronounced on November 14. Nair was hacked to death by the RSS workers who came to his house to attack his son, Sivaprasad, the erstwhile area secretary of SFI, the student wing of CPI(M).

82.title: Web portal for filing RTI applications 'practically ready': SC
82.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday said an online portal to file applications under the Right To Information (RTI) Act, 2005, for accessing information about the top court is "practically ready". A bench of Chief Justice DY Chandrachud and Justice Hima Kohli made the statement while hearing a plea that sought a mechanism to register RTI applications online.

83.title: Vice Prez Dhankhar in Cambodia for ASEAN-India, East Asia summits
83.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Friday arrived in Cambodian capital Phnom Penh to participate in the ASEAN-India Summit and the East Asia Summit. Dhankhar, who is on a three-day visit, will hold bilateral meetings with Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is part of the delegation accompanying the vice president.

84.title: Release of Rajiv Gandhi case convicts against public sentiments: Raj CM
84.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said the release of six convicts by Supreme Court in the former PM Rajiv Gandhi assassination case has come as a shock to the people of the country. "The order to release the killers of Shri Rajiv Gandhi, who sacrificed his life for...unity of the country...isn't in accordance with the public sentiment," Gehlot tweeted.

85.title: What is Team India's schedule after T20 World Cup 2022?
85.article_body: Following the T20 World Cup 2022, India will face New Zealand in 3 T20Is and 3 ODIs from November 18. India will then tour Bangladesh for three ODIs and two Tests from December 4. India will then host Sri Lanka and New Zealand for a three-match ODI series and a three-match T20I series each in January and February.

86.title: Foreign terrorist neutralised by security forces in J&K's Shopian
86.article_body: A foreign terrorist belonging to Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) was killed in an encounter with security forces in J&K's Shopian district on Friday, police said. The encounter broke out during a search operation launched by security forces following specific information regarding the presence of terrorists in the Kapren area, police informed. The terrorist has been identified as Kamran Bhai alias Hanees.

87.title: German lawmakers approve extending operational life of nuclear plants
87.article_body: German lawmakers on Friday voted in favour of operating the country's three remaining nuclear power plants till April next year. Germany had earlier planned to completely phase out nuclear power by the end of this year. However, Chancellor Olaf Scholz in October ordered the extension amid energy shortages following the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

88.title: PM awards honorary doctorate to 79-yr-old music maestro Ilaiyaraaja
88.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday presented an honorary doctorate to 79-year-old music maestro and Rajya Sabha MP Ilaiyaraaja at the 36th convocation ceremony of Tamil Nadu's Gandhigram Rural Institute. PM Modi also awarded an honorary doctorate to 86-year-old instrumentalist and Padma Vibhushan recipient Umayalpuram K Sivaraman. The two personalities are renowned musicians of southern India.

89.title: Key bridge near Kherson city has collapsed: Ukrainian state media
89.article_body: The Antonivskiy bridge, the only nearby bridge connecting the Ukrainian city of Kherson with the Russian-held eastern bank of the Dnipro river, has collapsed, Ukrainian state media reported on Friday. Ukraine's public broadcaster, Suspilne, published a photograph showing whole sections of the bridge missing. Earlier in the day, Russia said it had completed the withdrawal of forces from Kherson.

90.title: We must be ready to put in extra hours to build new U'khand: CM
90.article_body: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said a major change in work culture is needed to build a new Uttarakhand. "We must...be ready to put in extra hours of work if needed...We need to take pains and move ahead to fulfil our new commitments," said Dhami. He urged citizens to "give up the old mindset of working according to a 10-5 routine".

91.title: Samantha, Naga Chaitanya to reunite for a project: Reports
91.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Naga Chaitanya are reportedly teaming up for a project. "They appear to be in a place where they can let the bygones be bygones and work together professionally," a source was quoted as saying. Naga and Samantha got married in 2017 and announced their separation on social media in 2021.

92.title: Some rebel MLAs will certainly return: Sanjay Raut
92.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut said that some of their rebel MLAs, who are currently part of the Shiv Sena (Shinde), will return to the party fold. "What has Shiv Sena not done for these people? The party has done more for them than for me," Raut said. Notably, around 40 MLAs have turned into rebels.

93.title: He was a soft-spoken, well-mannered guy: Gautam on Siddhaanth's death
93.article_body: Actor Gautam Rode, remembering his 'Suryaputra Karn' co-star Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, said that he was a soft-spoken and well-mannered guy. "He was quite fit so I don't know what happened. There were no health concerns that I learnt about so news is just so shocking," he added. Siddhaanth died after he collapsed at a gym on Friday.

94.title: After 'Delhi Crime', I got offers from H'wood, South Korea & Iran: Adil
94.article_body: Actor Adil Hussain, speaking about his web show 'Delhi Crime' winning the International Emmy Award for Best Drama, said, "It's validation when a credible organisation like Emmy gives you an award." "Also, it gives me credibility in...world market. After 'Delhi Crime', there are so many offers from different parts of the world. From South Korea, Iran, Hollywood," he added.

95.title: AAP releases list of 30 star campaigners for Delhi MCD elections
95.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh are among AAP's 30 star campaigners for the Delhi MCD elections. MLA Rajendra Pal Gautam, who recently quit as minister after controversy over attending a religious conversion event, also features on the list. A star campaigner's expenditure on electioneering is not counted among a candidate's poll expenses.

96.title: India, US to work towards new global climate financing target
96.article_body: At the end of ninth India-US Economic and Financial Partnership meeting, India and US have agreed to come up with a new climate finance assistance deal for developing countries. "We acknowledge the developed country goal to jointly mobilise $100 billion every year till 2025 from public and private sources for developing countries," said the Indo-US joint statement.

97.title: Pak drawing inspiration from 1992 WC final win over Eng: Hayden
97.article_body: Ahead of the T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday, Pakistan's mentor Matthew Hayden said that the side is drawing inspiration from the win against England in the 1992 ODI WC final. The former Australian opener also added, "I think the bases are covered...I think both sides (England-Pakistan) actually have got very equal set-ups...It's just 'even-stevens'."

98.title: AIMIM to not contest Mainpuri, Rampur & Khatauli by-polls in UP
98.article_body: All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) will not contest the by-elections slated to be held in December in Uttar Pradesh. AIMIM state chief Shaukat Ali on Friday announced that the party will not field any candidate in Mainpuri Lok Sabha by-polls and Khatauli and Rampur Assembly by-elections. Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat fell vacant following Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's death.

99.title: CM Yogi, Minister Sonowal inaugurate 7 community jetties in Varanasi
99.article_body: Union minister Sarbananda Sonowal and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath launched seven jetties and laid the foundation stone for another eight in Varanasi on Friday. "PM Modi gifted Kashi the inland waterways. Now, with jetties in four districts, transportation on water will be more convenient," CM Yogi said. This will contribute to easing traffic movement on roads, he added.

100.title: Youth should become employment creators: Union Minister Gadkari
100.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said the youth should become "employment creators" and utilise the knowledge they gain for the benefit of the country. "Using knowledge and research, they can formulate the strengths and weaknesses of the society and devise solutions," said Gadkari. He added that youth as "employment creators" can fulfil PM Narendra Modi's vision of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat'.

101.title: It'll be my good fortune: Lalu's daughter Rohini on kidney donation
101.article_body: Rohini Acharya, who will reportedly donate a kidney to her father Lalu Prasad Yadav, on Friday tweeted, "It'll be my good fortune if I can do anything for the father who gave me voice." "My mother and father are like God to me. I can do anything for them," she added. "Your best wishes have made me stronger," Rohini said.

102.title: Ind men's hockey team has transformed in last 8-10 yrs: Ex-skipper
102.article_body: Ex-skipper MM Somaya said that the Indian men's hockey team has transformed itself in the last 8-10 years. "We are now among the top four teams in world hockey. I must compliment the coaching staff and the scientific training that is imported to these players," Somaya said. He added that India will hopefully win a medal at the World Cup.

103.title: 3 killed, 1 injured as truck rams into 2 bikes in MP's Jhabua
103.article_body: Three members of a family were killed and one person was injured when a rashly driven truck rammed into their motorcycles in Madhya Pradesh's Jhabua on Friday, police said. "The deceased...were travelling on two motorcycles," police added. The victims were tribals, aged between 23 and 25 years, witnesses stated, adding that the incident sparked protests at the accident site.

104.title: Law & order deteriorating in Punjab as AAP focused on Gujarat: SAD
104.article_body: President of Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) Sukhbir Singh Badal on Friday said there is "deterioration" in the law and order situation in Punjab as the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government is more focused on poll-bound Gujarat. "Gangsters are ruling the roost. Daylight robberies are happening, gangsters are extorting thousands of people and there is no control," Badal said.

105.title: Man who stabbed Belgian police officers was on terror watchlist
105.article_body: The suspected assailant who killed one police officer and injured another in a knife attack on Thursday in Brussels was on Belgium's terrorism watchlist, Belgian authorities said on Friday. Belgian federal prosecution magistrate Van Der Sypt said the suspect shouted "Allahu akbar" during the attack. The suspect, Yassine M, had been in prison between 2013 and 2019 for common-law crimes.

106.title: Actress Rozlyn Khan diagnosed with cancer, shares pic from hospital
106.article_body: Actress Rozlyn Khan took to her Instagram handle and announced that she has been diagnosed with cancer. Sharing a picture from the hospital, Rozlyn wrote, "There were no signs except severe pain in neck and back and I mistook it for gymnastics pain and stress on my back." "God gives toughest battles to his strongest soldiers," she added.

107.title: Mahatma Gandhi's ideas have answers for modern-day issues: PM Modi
107.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said the ideas of Mahatma Gandhi have answers for modern-day challenges, including ending conflicts and the climate crisis. "Our vision is 'Atma gaon ki, suvidha sheher ki (soul of a village, facilities of a city)," he said. He added that his government was inspired by Mahatma Gandhi to work towards its self-reliance goal of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat'.

108.title: BJP youth wing member arrested in TN for selling banned lottery tickets
108.article_body: A BJP youth wing member, Sabar Palan, was arrested in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Friday for selling Kerala lottery tickets that are banned in the state. During their morning patrol, police noticed Palan, BJP's district youth wing secretary, selling the banned tickets and arrested him. Ten Kerala lottery tickets were seized from him along with ₹6,400 cash, police said.

109.title: UNGA accuses Taliban of violating human rights of Afghan women
109.article_body: The United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) on Thursday adopted a resolution that blamed the Taliban for violating the human rights of women and girls in Afghanistan. The resolution pointed at the Taliban's failure in establishing a representative government, and pushing the country into "dire economic, humanitarian and social conditions".

110.title: MLA who called Bilkis Bano convicts 'sanskari' fielded by BJP from Godhra
110.article_body: BJP MLA and former Gujarat minister Chandrasinh Kanaksinh Raulji, who had called Bilkis Bano's rapists "sanskari" (cultured), is on the list of the ruling party's candidates for the state Assembly election next month. Raulji is BJP's candidate from Godhra. He was part of the state government committee that unanimously decided to release the 11 men guilty of raping Bilkis Bano.

111.title: World food import bill to rise to record $1.94 trillion in 2022: FAO
111.article_body: The world food import bill is estimated to rise to $1.94 trillion in 2022, higher than previously expected, according to a new report released by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). The new forecast would mark an all-time high and a 10% increase over the record level of 2021. "These are alarming signs from a food security perspective," FAO said.

112.title: Why Madhuri is called 'superstar of 90s' but Aamir isn't: Raveena
112.article_body: Raveena Tandon, speaking about how female and male actors are treated by media, said, "When Aamir (Khan) takes a break...and comes back...you don't call it his comeback...You don't say 'superstar of...90s' Aamir is with us." "But I see...many articles...about 'superstar of...90s Madhuri Dixit is now doing this'. She's been working continuously, how did you label her like that?" she added.

113.title: Freedom fighter Raghuveer Charan Sharma passes away in MP
113.article_body: Freedom fighter Raghuveer Charan Sharma died at a government hospital in Vidisha district in Madhya Pradesh on Thursday, said an official on Friday. He was 99. Sharma is survived by his wife,  daughter and two sons. As per protocol, Sharma will be accorded a guard of honour, said Collector Umashankar Bhargav.

114.title: LIC Q2 net profit jumps 11-fold to ₹15,952 cr; net premium income up 26%
114.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) reported over 11-fold jump in second quarter profit on Friday. It posted a standalone net profit of ₹15,952 crore for the July-September quarter as against ₹1,433 crore from a year ago. LIC's net premium income rose 26.6% year-over-year to ₹1.32 trillion. The insurer reported a net profit of ₹682.9 crore in June quarter.

115.title: Twitter pauses its newly introduced $8 blue tick verification feature: Report
115.article_body: Twitter has reportedly paused its $8/month Blue subscription service, which allowed people to pay for a verification check mark. Several users claimed that the Twitter Blue subscription option vanished from the iOS app's sidebar today, days after its launch. Several users, who already paid for the service, said that their paid-for blue checkmark has disappeared from their account.

116.title: US removes India from its currency monitoring list
116.article_body: The US Department of Treasury on Friday removed India along with Italy, Mexico, Thailand and Vietnam from its currency monitoring list. "The countries that have been removed from the list have met only one out of three criteria for two consecutive reports," it said. China, Japan, South Korea, Germany, Malaysia, Singapore, and Taiwan are a part of the list currently.

117.title: Sania Mirza, Shoaib Malik to announce divorce after settling legal issues: Reports
117.article_body: Sania Mirza and Shoaib Malik will announce that they have separated from each other after resolving legal issues, Pakistan's Geo News reported citing sources. A member of Shoaib Malik's management department has reportedly confirmed the divorce, with the couple's 'close friends' saying that only the paperwork remains. The couple got married in 2010 and have a four-year-old son together.

118.title: Of all roles I played, nothing comes close to being mom: Preity on twins' b'day
118.article_body: Preity Zinta took to Instagram on Friday to share pictures with her twin children Gia and Jai on the occasion of their first birthday. Sharing a picture with Jai, she wrote, "Of all...roles I've played...nothing comes close to that of being your mom." "You are everything I ever hoped for & more," Preity wrote while sharing a picture with Gia.

119.title: Release of Rajiv Gandhi case convicts a victory for us: AIADMK
119.article_body: AIADMK leader D Jayakumar said that the release of six convicts by the Supreme Court in the former PM Rajiv Gandhi assassination case is a victory for the party. The legal steps taken by the previous AIADMK-led regimes (2011-21) helped in the release of the convicts, however, now the DMK government is attempting to take credit for it, Jayakumar added.

120.title: SRK wishes Deepika on completing 15 years in B'wood, shares pics
120.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter on Friday to wish Deepika Padukone on completing 15 years in Bollywood. He shared a collage of the stills from the films he did with Deepika. "To 15 fabulous years of excellence...perseverance...amazing performances with you and the warm hugs!! Here's looking at you...Looking at you...and looking at you...and still looking at you," he wrote.

121.title: India's forex reserves fall by $1.087 billion to $529.994 billion
121.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $1.087 billion to $529.994 billion for the week ended November 4, Reserve Bank of India data showed. This comes a week after foreign exchange reserves logged their biggest weekly jump since September 2021. The decline was led by gold reserves which dropped by $705 million to $37.057 billion.

122.title: How much prize money will Team India get from T20 World Cup 2022?
122.article_body: India were knocked out of T20 World Cup 2022 in semi-final stage after winning four matches in Super 12 stage. The tournament has a $5.6-million prize money pool, which will be shared by all 16 participating teams. India will receive $40,000 each for their Super 12 stage victories and $400,000 for being the losing semi-finalist, taking the total to $560,000.

123.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
123.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next few days. Heavy rainfall is likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands on November 14 and 15. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala on November 12 and 13. It's very likely over Andhra Pradesh on November 12.

124.title: Memorable moment: Students as PM attends convocation in TN institute
124.article_body: Some students of Tamil Nadu's Gandhigram Rural Institute on Friday said that PM Narendra Modi attending their convocation ceremony was a memorable moment for them. One said, "It was a happy moment...that PM Modi [and]...CM MK Stalin could join us for our convocation." PM Modi, the guest of honour, awarded gold medals to winners and honoris causa to deserving candidates.

125.title: 2 Maoists killed in encounter with police in Odisha
125.article_body: At least two Maoists were killed in an encounter with security personnel on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday in Odisha's Koraput district, a police official said. Several other Maoists are suspected of having sustained injuries in the gunfight, he said. The encounter broke out during a combing operation by district police and the Special Operation Group, PTI reported.

126.title: Bengal not sharing dengue data despite repeated requests: Centre
126.article_body: Union Minister of State for Health Bharati Pravin Pawar on Friday said the West Bengal government has not been sharing any information on dengue with the Centre despite repeated requests. According to Pawar, the Centre has received feedback from all other states. "We have been sending information for many months," state Director of Health Services Siddhartha Niyogi said in response.

127.title: Don't know why India didn't play Chahal in a single match: Akhtar
127.article_body: Ex-Pakistani pacer Shoaib Akhtar questioned India's move of not fielding spinner Yuzvendra Chahal in a single match of the T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. "It's a confusing team selection for India...Their bowling was exposed very badly...These (Australian) conditions are helpful for fast bowling, and India doesn't have an express pacer," Akhtar, who is considered the fastest bowler ever, said.

128.title: Ex-crypto billionaire Bankman-Fried quits as FTX CEO, exchange files for bankruptcy
128.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried's cryptocurrency exchange FTX has filed for bankruptcy in the US, a statement from FTX said on Friday. The 30-year-old former crypto billionaire has resigned as CEO of FTX and John J Ray III will take his place, the statement said. Around 130 additional affiliated companies, apart from Alameda Research Limited are part of the bankruptcy proceedings.

129.title: Eurozone set to fall into recession this winter: European Commission
129.article_body: The Eurozone economy will slide into recession in the last quarter of 2022, as inflation continues to rise, the European Commission's latest economic forecast released on Friday said. According to the forecast, high energy bills currently eroding consumer purchasing power will cause prolonged inflation which is estimated to spike to 8.5% this year and then fall to 6.1% next year.

130.title: Aaditya Thackeray joins Rahul's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra
130.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray joined Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra on Friday. The former state minister was seen marching beside Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in Kalamnuri, Hingoli. Uddhav Thackeray has also been invited to join the march. Notably, Shiv Sena and Congress were part of the coalition government that governed Maharashtra till June 29, 2022.

131.title: Nose grown on woman's arm transplanted to her face in France, pic surfaces
131.article_body: A woman in France grew a nose on her arm for it to be transplanted on her face after she lost a portion of her own during cancer treatment. A nose, made from 3D-printed biomaterial, was implanted on her forearm. Using skin graft to cover the replacement nose, the appendage grew on her arm for two months before the transplant.

132.title: Unacceptable: SC on govt withholding names for appointment of judges
132.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday, expressing disapproval over the Centre withholding names recommended for appointment as judges in the higher judiciary, said it's "not acceptable". "It is becoming some sort of a device to compel these persons to withdraw their names, as has happened," the SC bench added. "Post second reiteration, only the appointment has to be issued," it said.

133.title: What are the coincidences between ODI World Cup 1992 and T20 World Cup 2022?
133.article_body: Pakistan will face England in T20 World Cup 2022 final in Melbourne, just like Pakistan faced England in ODI World Cup 1992 final in Melbourne. Pakistan lost opening games in both tournaments. Pakistan won last three matches in group stage of both the tournaments. Pakistan lost to India in both tournaments, and defeated New Zealand in semi-final of both events.

134.title: Bring 1-time settlement of dues to keep projects viable: Noida developers
134.article_body: Real estate developers in Noida and Greater Noida have suggested that authorities create a one-time settlement scheme for clearing land dues to keep projects viable. The local Credai made the suggestion following the Supreme Court's recent order. On November 7, the court recalled the 8% cap on interest rates for land dues in Noida and Greater Noida.

135.title: I was all alone in distress for 3-4 days after Sridevi's death: Boney
135.article_body: Boney Kapoor, who quit smoking a year before Sridevi's death, said he wanted to smoke after his wife passed away as he was "all alone in distress, tension...[and] anxiety" for 3-4 days in Dubai. "Then I said...If I truly love her...I'll not...I didn't then," he added. Sridevi passed away in 2018 while she was in Dubai for a family wedding.

136.title: Despite losing WC, Ind players will remain superstars: Ex-player
136.article_body: Former India pacer Atul Wassan said that despite crashing out of the ongoing T20 World Cup, Indian cricketers will continue to remain superstars. "The threshold for satisfaction has gotten really low...They've been rewarded a lot more for a lot less," Wassan said. He added, "They think that even if they lose the World Cup, nothing is lost. Life goes on."

137.title: Didn't know if Kapil will be able to act: 'Zwigato' co-star Shahana
137.article_body: Actress Shahana Goswami said in an interview that she really enjoyed working with Kapil Sharma in the upcoming movie 'Zwigato'. "It was so effortless. I didn't know how he'd be. He's such a big star. I didn't know if he'd be able to act," she added. Shahana further said when she met Kapil, she was convinced that "he'll nail it".

138.title: TRS politicising PM Modi's visit to Ramagundam: Union Minister
138.article_body: Union minister G Kishan Reddy on Thursday criticised the TRS and claimed that the party was politicising PM Narendra Modi's visit to Telangana's Ramagundam. Speaking about setting up of fertiliser plant in Ramagundam, he said, "The state government was not extending...support in infrastructure development and resorting to cheap criticism." The Centre is committed to state's  development, he added.

139.title: Was tortured in jail, will apprise PM Modi of my experience: Raut
139.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, who was released from jail on bail in an alleged money laundering case on Wednesday, said, "I was tortured in jail." "I'll soon meet PM [Narendra Modi], Home Minister [Amit Shah] and Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis to apprise them of my experience and to make them aware of actions taken against me," Raut added.

140.title: 39 arrested in 5 months for online threats: Pimpri Chinchwad Police
140.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police has arrested 39 people in the last five months for brandishing weapons and issuing threats on social media. Police said a rivalry between the Sarkar group and Baba group in Talegaon Dabhade town led to threats being issued online. Further, this rivalry has led to violence and the death of a 19-year-old man.

141.title: 5 revenue districts in Delhi 'overexploiting' groundwater: Report
141.article_body: Out of the 11 revenue districts in Delhi, five are extracting more groundwater than the amount being recharged annually, the Central Ground Water Board said in a report. This level of extraction has been described as 'overexploitation'. New Delhi, North Delhi, South Delhi, Southwest Delhi and Shahdara are the revenue districts that are exploiting groundwater, according to the report.

142.title: BJP expels Himachal member for 6 years for 'anti-party' activities
142.article_body:
The Himachal Pradesh BJP on Friday expelled state executive committee member Anu Thakur for 'anti-party' activities ahead of voting in the state. According to a statement released by the BJP, 
Thakur has been expelled from the party's primary membership for six years. Thakur was allegedly working against the leaders of her party while campaigning ahead of Assembly elections.

143.title: Pune Police seizes banned narcotics in separate cases, 3 arrested
143.article_body: Pune Police's Anti-Narcotics Cell has arrested three people in two separate incidents and seized banned narcotic substances from them. On Wednesday, a man was arrested in Pune's Budhwar Peth area and 38 tablets of mescaline were seized from him. On Thursday, two persons were arrested near the entry gate of Pune railway station and 10 gm mephedrone was seized.

144.title: After dogs & horses, pet cats to be registered by Pune civic body
144.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to charge ₹50 as an annual license fee for the registration of pet cats in the city. PMC said the decision was taken after receiving complaints of pet cats creating a nuisance in residential societies. The civic body has been registering pet dogs and horses at its ward offices for some time.

145.title: A coin has two sides, so does life: Sachin Tendulkar on India's T20 World Cup 2022 exit
145.article_body: After India crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 following their 10-wicket defeat against England in the semi-final, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "A coin has two sides, so does life." He added, "If we celebrate our team's success like our own then we should be able to take our team's losses too...In life, they both go hand in hand."

146.title: 3 shooters held over Dera Sacha Sauda follower's murder in Punjab
146.article_body: Three of the six shooters involved in the murder of Dera Sacha Sauda follower Pardeep Singh, an accused in the 2015 Bargari sacrilege case, in Punjab's Faridkot district were apprehended on Friday. According to police, the accused had fired about 60 bullets at Singh. While four of the assailants are from Haryana, two others are from Punjab, police added.

147.title: PhysicsWallah launches vertical for UPSC aspirants
147.article_body: Edtech startup PhysicsWallah has launched UPSC Wallah to prepare students for Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) exams. "The launch of UPSC Wallah is well in sync with our vision of providing quality content at affordable rates and helping aspirants prepare for diverse competitive exams," CEO Alakh Pandey said. The vertical offers multiple courses for the 2023 and 2024 UPSC exams.

148.title: Less than 25% citizens have linked Aadhaar to voter ID: Pune admin
148.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) and district administration said their campaign to link Aadhaar cards to the voters' list is getting a cold response. Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh said hardly 25% of voters have come forward to link the two in the city. The EC has said that it is not mandatory for citizens to do the linking.

149.title: Foolish for people to think we'll pay Messi after layoffs: Byju's founder on criticism
149.article_body: Byju's Co-founder Byju Raveendran has addressed the backlash over the edtech firm signing footballer Lionel Messi as its global brand ambassador amid layoffs. "The deal with Messi is not a typical sponsorship deal. It is a partnership to create social impact," said Byju. "It's foolish for people to think we'll pay money for Messi after letting people go," he added.

150.title: Delhi HC dismisses plea challenging CJI Chandrachud's appointment
150.article_body: The Delhi HC on Friday dismissed a public interest litigation (PIL) challenging the appointment of Justice DY Chandrachud as the 50th Chief Justice of India (CJI). Dismissing the plea, a division bench headed by Chief Justice Satish Chandra Sharma observed that the petition was "publicity oriented". The bench also imposed a cost of ₹1 lakh on the petitioner.

151.title: Match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 final announced
151.article_body: The ICC on Friday announced match officials for T20 World Cup 2022 final, which will take place on Sunday. Umpires Marais Erasmus and Kumar Dharmasena will assume on-field duties in the final between England and Pakistan. Chris Gaffaney will be the TV umpire, while Paul Reiffel will be the fourth umpire. Ranjan Madugalle will be the match referee.

152.title: Navy officer goes missing in Navi Mumbai, family demands CBI probe
152.article_body: A 22-year-old Navy officer, who worked as a chef at INS Abhimanyu base camp in Navi Mumbai has been missing since November 3. "We are not getting any good response from either the Navy or police...want the case to be now investigated by CBI," said the officer's family. The Navy said they have started their procedures in the case.

153.title: MMA fighter Ritu Phogat marries businessman Sachin Chhikara, shares pics
153.article_body: Indian MMA fighter Ritu Phogat, the sister of wrestlers Geeta and Babita Phogat, got married to businessman Sachin Chhikara. Sharing pictures on social media, she wrote, "I'm so lucky to be called your wife now and I can't wait to spend...rest of our life together...It was a very magical and special day that I loved absolutely very second of it."

154.title: Withdrawal of troops, equipment from Kherson city complete: Russia
154.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Friday said it had completed the withdrawal of forces from the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson. No loss of personnel or equipment was reported during the retreat from the western bank of the Dnipro river to its eastern bank, the ministry added. Russia said its forces had adopted "defensive lines and positions" on Dnipro's eastern bank.

155.title: Sai Tamhankar shares post on 'struggle' with pic of her sleeping on cart, people react
155.article_body: Actress Sai Tamhankar, who starred in 'Mimi', shared a picture from sets of her film, which shows her sleeping on a handcart. "The struggle is real!...In between shots we'd...adjust," she wrote. Criticising it, a person said, "A person to hold...umbrella...so that you can nap!!! [Great] adjustment", while another person wrote, "It's called privilege...someone is holding an umbrella for you."

156.title: Don't see any point in Virat, Rohit playing T20Is for Ind: Tom Moody
156.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Tom Moody said that he doesn't see any point in batters Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma playing T20 cricket for India. "With two years to play out, I'd be surprised if they (Kohli-Rohit) play a lot of T20 cricket for India between now and that World Cup [in 2024]," Moody, who played 76 ODIs, said.

157.title: 24 cheated of investments worth ₹88 lakh by man in Mumbai
157.article_body: Mumbai police said about 24 individuals were allegedly cheated of ₹88 lakh by one Deepak Mhaskar under the pretext of various investments. Mhaskar reportedly opened an investment company named 'Happiness For All', with its office in Borivali and promised high returns on people's investments. Later, after taking money from at least 24 people, the accused disappeared, said the police.

158.title: Allot 50% hostel capacity to girl UG students: CEC to Nizam College
158.article_body: Commissionerate of Collegiate Education (CEC) has directed Hyderabad's Nizam College to allot 50% of hostel capacity to female UG students and 50% to female PG students in the new hostel on the campus. Earlier, students protested against the non-allotment of rooms to UG students. Telangana Education Minister Sabitha Indra Reddy said the state resolved the matter with a humanitarian perspective.

159.title: MMRTA hikes prepaid taxi fares from Mumbai airport
159.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA) hiked the fare of prepaid black and yellow taxis being operated from the Mumbai airport. The revised minimum fare for a prepaid taxi for up to six km will be ₹140 from the international terminal, while the minimum fare up to four km from the domestic terminal will be ₹93, an official said.

160.title: Even Healthcare raises $15 mn from Alpha Wave and Lightrock
160.article_body: Bengaluru-based Even Healthcare, a subscription-based personalised healthcare startup, on Friday raised $15 million from Alpha Wave and Lightrock (Aspada). The funding will be used to expand its clinical team and scale preventive care in conditions like diabetes, PCOS (polycystic ovary syndrome) and obesity. In 2021, Even raised $5 million in a seed round led by Khosla Ventures.

161.title: He's our first choice for any twisted story: 'An Action...' maker on Ayushmann
161.article_body: Aanand L Rai, producer of Ayushmann Khurrana's upcoming movie 'An Action Hero', spoke about casting Ayushmann and said, "[He] is our first choice for any twisted story." "This is an action film with a twist and Ayushmann has come on board due to the twist," he added. The film, scheduled to release on December 2, will also feature Jaideep Ahlawat.

162.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' aims to protect India's diversity: Kanhaiya Kumar
162.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar on Friday said that diversity was India's strength and the aim of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' was to protect it. Addressing a press conference in Maharashtra's Nanded, Kumar said there's difference between a political yatra and an electoral one. "In the current political discourse, non-issues are being given priority, while important ones are sidelined," he added.

163.title: Don't agree with Sonia Gandhi: Congress on release of Rajiv Gandhi killing convicts
163.article_body: Congress 'disagrees' with Sonia Gandhi's views on the release of the convicts of her husband Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said. "Sonia Gandhi...is entitled to her personal views," he said, calling the release "entirely untenable, undefendable". Sonia Gandhi had pleaded for leniency for convict Nalini, leading to her sentence being reduced to life term.

164.title: Do authorities care: Biocon chief as kids get stuck in B'luru traffic
164.article_body: After children missed school due to traffic jam in Bengaluru, Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "Do the authorities even care? Citizens will have to keep shaming them into action." She stated that "ground-level officials" need to be held accountable. Meanwhile, ex-Infosys Director Mohandas Pai asked, "Is there hope at all in Bengaluru? What are police doing to clear traffic?"

165.title: Ola to shut down its infotainment service Ola Play from Nov 15
165.article_body: Ride-hailing startup Ola on Friday announced that it will shut its 'Ola Play' service in India effective from November 15. Launched in 2016, Ola Play is an in-cab infotainment service which provides customers access to music, videos and other such services. In a public notice, Ola said it has taken appropriate measures to remove the segment from the market.

166.title: Orchestra bar raided in Mumbai; 23 arrested, 13 women rescued
166.article_body: An orchestra bar, which was allegedly being operated illegally in Mumbai's Ghatkopar, was raided and 23 persons were arrested and 13 women rescued, police said on Friday. Women were allegedly found dancing in the establishment, police said, adding those arrested included the bar manager, cashier, seven waiters and 13 customers. Police seized ₹35,760 cash and computer equipment during the raid.

167.title: It is a very good film, I cried a lot: Shehnaaz Gill on 'Uunchai'
167.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill called Sooraj R Barjatya's 'Uunchai' a "very good film" and said that she "cried a lot" after watching it. "One message that I've got from this movie is that impossible things can be made possible," she added. Shehnaaz attended the special screening of the film on Wednesday, which was hosted by Anupam Kher's acting school, Actor Prepares.

168.title: 46-yr-old man kills brother over family dispute in Hyderabad
168.article_body: A 46-year-old man, Komera David, allegedly killed his 42-year-old brother, Komera Jonah, in Hyderabad's Jagathgiri Gutta over a family dispute. According to police, the two had been fighting over property and sharing their parents' responsibility for the last few years. On Wednesday, they had an argument, after which David allegedly grabbed a granite stone and hit Jonah on his head.

169.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
169.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Friday, with Bihar's Motihari and Siwan having the highest AQI at 413 and 406, respectively. This is followed by Bettiah (395), Darbhanga (388), Begusarai (381), Buxar (377), Jind (371), Purnia (358), Saharsa (358), Gurugram (353) and Delhi (346).

170.title: SoftBank Group reports $21-billion quarterly profit after Alibaba deal
170.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group on Friday reported a net profit of 3.033 trillion yen ($21.77 billion) for the July-September quarter, marking the first net profit in three quarters. This comes after it logged gains related to sales of its shares in Alibaba Group Holding. Meanwhile, SoftBank Vision Fund posted a 1.38 trillion yen ($9.8 billion) investment loss in the second quarter.

171.title: ED searches Binance wallet IDs, freezes ₹22.82-cr Bitcoins in E-nuggets case
171.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) searched wallet or user IDs associated with Binance cryptocurrency exchange in a probe related to the mobile gaming app E-nuggets on Friday. ED froze 150.22 Bitcoins worth ₹22.82 crore. In October, ED conducted raids on two premises in Kolkata. ED alleged Aamir Khan, businessman Nesar Ahmed Khan's son, launched E-nuggets that was designed to defraud the public.

172.title: Kherson's status as 'part of Russia' unchanged: Kremlin despite retreat
172.article_body: The Kremlin said that Russian forces' withdrawal from Kherson wouldn't change the status of the region. "It is legally fixed and defined," it added. Russia annexed Kherson and three other Ukrainian regions after holding what it called referendums in September. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Russia remained committed to achieving the goals of its "special military operation" in Ukraine.

173.title: 3 bar bouncers booked for assaulting 2 brothers in Gurugram
173.article_body: A case was registered on Wednesday against three bouncers for allegedly assaulting two brothers at a bar in Gurugram's Sector 42 on October 21. According to police, the assault took place when the men intervened in an altercation between their friends and the bouncers. The duo was found to have sustained multiple blunt force injuries, as per doctors, said police.

174.title: AAP releases manifesto for MCD polls, promises to make Delhi garbage-free
174.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal released AAP's manifesto for the upcoming MCD polls, scheduled to take place on December 4, and promised to make the city garbage-free.
