He also promised to make the MCD corruption-free and solve vehicle parking problems as part of the manifesto. He has also assured people that the MCD workers will get their salaries on time.

175.title: US to send $400 million more to Ukraine as military aid
175.article_body: The US will send $400 million more in military aid to Ukraine, US officials said on Thursday. According to the Pentagon, the aid package will include Stinger missiles, 10,000 mortar rounds, thousands of artillery rounds for howitzers and 400 grenade launchers. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US defence systems are "just what we needed and what we asked for".

176.title: 35-year-old auto driver dies by suicide after killing wife in Hyd
176.article_body: A 35-year-old autorickshaw driver allegedly killed his 33-year-old wife and then committed suicide on Thursday at their home in Hyderabad's Jagadgirigutta area. Police discovered the remains of Raju and Kavitha in different rooms of their home. As per the police, the couple frequently got into arguments. Raju hanged himself from a ceiling fan after confirming Kavitha's death, the police said.

177.title: Good day for democracy & America: Joe Biden on midterm election
177.article_body: After the initial outcome of the midterm election, US President Joe Biden said it was a good day for democracy and America. "Our democracy has been tested in recent years, but with their votes, the American people have spoken...once again that democracy is who we are," Biden said. Vote counting in states including Arizona and Nevada is underway.

178.title: UK economy contracts by 0.2% in third quarter: ONS
178.article_body: The UK economy contracted by 0.2% in the third quarter, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said. The Bank of England last week said the UK economy was set to contract in the final quarter, indicating the economy was in a recession, adding the economy could remain in recession until mid-2024. UK inflation is at a four-decade high above 10%.

179.title: Rahul Dravid given break for New Zealand tour, VVS Laxman to coach India
179.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has been given a break for the tour of New Zealand, with VVS Laxman taking over as acting head coach. As per a PTI report, Hrishikesh Kanitkar and Sairaj Bahutule will take up roles of batting and bowling coach, respectively, for the tour. The tour will commence with a three-match T20I series on November 18.

180.title: Police officer being investigated over Seoul's Halloween crush found dead
180.article_body: A South Korean police officer being investigated in connection with the Halloween crowd crush that killed over 150 people in Seoul was found dead in his home on Friday. Jeong was accused of ordering the destruction of an intelligence report warning of a serious accident over Halloween in Itaewon, after an investigation began into police responses to the crush.

181.title: 70-year-old UP farmer dies as bees attack him in agricultural field
181.article_body: A 70-year-old farmer died after a swarm of bees attacked him while he was working in an agricultural field in Uttar Pradesh. The incident came to light when the farmer did not return back home. His body was found covered in bees. While the villagers were able to disperse the bees using smoke, he had passed away by then.

182.title: Father-son duo arrested for cheating people of ₹20 crore in Hyderabad
182.article_body: The Hyderabad Central Crime Station (CCS) police arrested a man and his son for allegedly cheating people of ₹20 crore on the pretext of developing a property. "Nine cases have been registered against [them] this year. The accused were trying to escape from the country when our team arrested them at Ram Koti on Thursday," the ACP of CCS said.

183.title: Come to Kolkata: Derek to Vir after his B'luru show gets cancelled
183.article_body: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Friday invited stand-up comedian Vir Das to Kolkata after his show was cancelled in Bengaluru following protests by a right-wing group. "We would love to have you here this winter," he tweeted. Earlier, Das released a video saying, "Many assumptions are made about my content...I trust my art and my audience to speak for me."

184.title: Kartik Aaryan joins Suniel Shetty, Paresh Rawal in 'Hera Pheri 3'
184.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has joined the cast of 'Hera Pheri 3', Paresh Rawal has confirmed. According to a report, Kartik will play Raju, a role which was previously played by Akshay Kumar. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, Akshay has opted out of the film as he "couldn't align with the...script idea". The film will reportedly also feature Suniel Shetty.

185.title: Iran agrees to set up a meeting with IAEA to discuss uranium traces
185.article_body: Iran has agreed to a visit by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on the issue of the origin of uranium particles found at three sites, Reuters reported citing a confidential IAEA document. The IAEA "expects to start receiving...technically credible explanations...including access to locations and material, as well as the taking of samples as appropriate", the document added.

186.title: India, US are natural allies, says US Treasury Secy Yellen
186.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen during her visit to New Delhi on Friday said US and India are "natural allies". "We may be located across the world from each other, but what unites us is far greater than any of our differences," Yellen added. "India's G20 year is a chance to accelerate global coordination on debt restructuring," she further said.

187.title: Kangana Ranaut calls Instagram 'dumb', says 'It is all about pictures'
187.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Friday and called the social media platform "dumb". She said it "is all about pictures". "Whatever opinion one writes disappears...next day as if everyone is a...frivolous dumbo...who doesn't want to see what he/she wrote a day before because they anyway don't mean what they say, so it [should] rather disappear," Kangana added.

188.title: Man participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra gets hit by truck in Maha, dies
188.article_body: A 62-year-old man from Tamil Nadu, Ganesan Ponraman, died and another person from that state was injured after being hit by a truck in Maharashtra's Nanded district when they were participating in Congress's ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra, a police official said on Friday. Expressing grief, former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi said, "We have lost a true soldier of the party."

189.title: 'Whisper list' contains 40 UK politicians never to accept a drink from: Female MP
189.article_body: An MP has claimed there is a "whisper list" of roughly 40 UK politicians to keep at arm's length. Charlotte Nichols, the MP for Warrington North, said she was warned of colleagues to never accept a drink from or be alone with. The list, which is not written down, includes people known for "bullying or sexual misconduct".

190.title: Mahindra to sell 80% controlling stake in Peugeot Motocycles
190.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra announced that it is selling 80% controlling stake in its French unit Peugeot Motocycles to Germany-based Mutares. "Mutares has submitted an irrevocable binding offer to acquire 50% of equity and a controlling stake of 80% in Peugeot Motocycles," it said. Mahindra will remain a co-shareholder to support new product launches and the growth expected in coming years.

191.title: Screen 3,000 Govandi houses daily: Health dept to BMC amid measles outbreak
191.article_body: After Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) confirmed measles outbreak in Govandi's Rafi Nagar, state health department officials visited the area on Thursday. They directed BMC officials to conduct door-to-door screening of 3,000 houses daily, for the next 10 days. "A special camp will be conducted to immunise kids who have missed their vaccination(s)," joint director (health services) said.

192.title: Shefali's son compares her to Robert as Iron Man; says no one can replace you
192.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said her son said that she became like Iron Man in 'Delhi Crime 2'. "He said, 'Every Marvel superhero has been portrayed by various actors, except Iron Man...It's only Robert Downey Jr. Nobody can replace him and it's the same about you'," she added. She said she thought he meant it as her being a superwoman.

193.title: Hong Kong jails woman journalist for insulting China's national anthem
193.article_body: A woman journalist who waved a British colonial-era flag to celebrate Hong Kong claiming Olympic gold in 2021 has become the first person in the city to be jailed on a charge of insulting Chinese national anthem. Paula Leung allegedly waved the flag at a shopping mall when Chinese national anthem was playing during the streaming of the award ceremony.

194.title: Man stabbed, robbed by auto driver and his aide in Gurugram
194.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed and robbed by an autorickshaw driver and his accomplice on National Highway 48 near Gurugram's Iffco Chowk on Thursday afternoon, police said. According to the victim, the driver's aide was masquerading as another passenger. The victim was allegedly robbed of ₹300 and his phone. He was purportedly stabbed in his chest and right hand.

195.title: PM flags 1st 8-day religious tour from K'taka-Kashi, train package costs ₹20,000
195.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday flagged off the first eight-day religious tour of the Bharat Gaurav train from Bengaluru to Varanasi. The train will go through Hubballi, Belagavi in Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj and Ayodhya. The all-inclusive package costs ₹20,000 and the state government will give ₹5,000 as a subsidy. The first journey will carry around 600 pilgrims.

196.title: 'Modi no entry' banners appear in Hyd ahead of PM's Telangana visit
196.article_body: 'Modi no entry to Telangana' flex banners have appeared in Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills and HITEC City areas of Hyderabad ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the state. The banners, purportedly installed by Telangana Chenetha Youth Force, asked the PM to roll back 5% GST on handloom products. PM Modi is slated to visit the state on Saturday.

197.title: 'Shivling' found in Gyanvapi to be protected till further orders: Supreme Court
197.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday extended its earlier order for the protection of the 'Shivling' discovered at the Gyanvapi mosque complex in UP's Varanasi. This means the May 17 order of the apex court has been extended. The ruling came on an appeal by the Hindu side to extend the order, which was to expire tomorrow (November 12).

198.title: Jacqueline's interim bail in ₹200 crore money laundering case extended till Nov 15
198.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez's interim bail in a ₹200 crore money laundering case has been extended till November 15. The order on regular bail will be pronounced on that day. While hearing her bail plea, the court on Thursday warned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) not to implement a "pick-and-choose policy" and questioned why it hasn't arrested her yet.

199.title: ASI found dead with gunshot injury inside police station in Punjab
199.article_body: The police have launched an investigation after a 50-year-old Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was found dead inside a police station in Punjab's Ludhiana with a gunshot injury. The deceased's colleagues claimed that he was in depression since his wife died. "It is yet to be ascertained if it was a suicide or accidental injury," the Station House Officer (SHO) said.

200.title: Who are the 6 convicts granted premature bail in Rajiv Gandhi assassination case?
200.article_body: India's longest-serving woman convict Nalini Sriharan and her husband Murugan alias Sriharan (alleged mastermind) are among six people granted premature bail in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. Sri Lankans Santhan (an LTTE Intelligence Wing member) and Robert Payas (a suspected LTTE member) were also among them. RP Ravichandran and Jayakumar (Payas' brother-in-law) were also released.

201.title: Twitter handle named 'Jesus Christ' gets blue tick after $8 plan; people react
201.article_body: A Twitter handle named 'Jesus Christ' has received the blue verification tick after CEO Elon Musk's $8/month for blue tick plan rolled out. Reacting to the account, a Twitter user said, "I'm still waiting for Santa to come on Twitter.....I just KNOW he's real!" "I see no confusion here. The Lord has returneth. Praise be to Saint Musk," said another.

202.title: 9 players shortlisted for Player of the T20 World Cup 2022 award, list released
202.article_body: The 9-member shortlist for the Player of the T20 World Cup 2022 award has been revealed by the ICC. Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav are the two Indians who have made the cut. The other seven players include Pakistan's Shadab Khan and Shaheen Afridi, England's Sam Curran, Jos Buttler and Alex Hales, Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza and Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga.

203.title: Foxconn to quadruple workforce at Tamil Nadu iPhone plant: Report
203.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn plans to quadruple the workforce to 70,000 at its iPhone factory in Tamil Nadu over two years, Reuters reported citing two government officials. This development comes even as Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant, the world's largest iPhone factory, is facing disruptions in production over China's COVID-19 policy impacting global supply chains. Foxconn opened the India plant in 2019.

204.title: Liquor ban unsuccessful in Bihar, needs public support: Upendra Kushwaha
204.article_body: According to JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha, the liquor ban in Bihar has been unsuccessful till now. He urged citizens of the state to come forward to make it successful. "It's a chain between the suppliers and the consumers…if the sale is stopped in Bihar, its consumption will also stop…it cannot be implemented successfully without [public support]," said Kushwaha.

205.title: CO2 emissions from fossil fuels to hit all time high this year: Scientists at COP27
205.article_body: While speaking at the ongoing COP27 climate summit, scientists from the Global Carbon Project warned that harmful carbon dioxide emissions from fossil fuels would rise 1% more this year, reaching an all-time high. Scientists added that emissions declined to -5.2% in 2020 due to restrictions imposed during the COVID pandemic. However, emissions increased by 5.6% in 2021.

206.title: Unacceptable: Jairam as SC orders release of Rajiv Gandhi case convicts
206.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Friday called the decision "totally unacceptable" as the Supreme Court ordered the release of six convicts serving life terms in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. "The Congress Party criticises it clearly...It is most unfortunate that the Supreme Court has not acted in consonance with the spirit of India on this issue," he added.

207.title: Sensex jumps 1,200 points, Nifty ends above 18,300 after hitting 52-week highs
207.article_body: The Sensex jumped nearly 1,200 points to close at 61,795 on Friday, while the Nifty gained more than 320 points to end at nearly 18,350. The benchmark indices hit 52-week highs during the intraday trade, aided by gains across IT, metals, realty and banking stocks. Meanwhile, the Indian rupee was trading higher by 86 paise at 80.95 per US dollar.

208.title: Why were govt funds used for Kempegowda's statue in Bengaluru: Shivakumar
208.article_body: Congress leader DK Shivakumar asked why government funds were used to install Bengaluru founder Nadaprabhu Kempegowda's statue in the city's international airport. "Using government funds [for installing statue] is a big crime...The Bengaluru International Airport Limited...should have used its money...Is it not earning?" Shivakumar asked. Notably, PM Narendra Modi unveiled the statue on Friday.

209.title: Man from Bihar molests 10-year-old girl inside Delhi mosque; arrested
209.article_body: The Delhi Police arrested a man for allegedly molesting a 10-year-old girl inside a mosque in the Maujpur area of the national capital. The 24-year-old accused has been identified as Mohammad Imran, who hails from Bihar's Kishanganj. "An FIR under sections 354…and 341…of the Indian Penal Code and [section] 10 [of] POCSO Act was registered," said a police officer.

210.title: Zoho using Sanskrit to build machine translation software: CEO
210.article_body: Indigenous software-as-a-service company Zoho is working on developing a machine translation software using Sanskrit as an intermediary layer. "When you translate between any two languages, you have to first go to a common format...Whole point here is to be the most precise...feature of the Sanskrit language that it is very precise and accurate," Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu said.

211.title: I don't agree that India made above-par total & lost because of bowling: Sehwag
211.article_body: Virender Sehwag said India lost their semi-final against England in the first 10 overs of the game. "If India feel they made an above-par total and it's bowling's fault, I don't agree," he added. "If the top order [scores 77 in 12 overs]...expecting the rest of the batters to...score 100 runs in eight overs, that's not right," Sehwag further said.

212.title: Hyderabad Police conduct rowdy sheeters mela, 47 rowdy sheets closed
212.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday conducted a rowdy sheeters mela at CAR headquarters, where 47 rowdy sheets in south zone were closed by Police Commissioner CV Anand. According to a police statement, 35 rowdy sheets were closed because they maintained a clean record for the last 10 years. The others were closed based on their health records, the statement added.

213.title: Actress Parvati Nair often slapped me, spit on me: Domestic help accused of theft
213.article_body: Actress Parvati Nair's domestic help, whom she accused of theft, has alleged that she used to often slap him and spit on him. He claimed that the actress framed him for theft because he had seen unknown people visiting her house at night. Two watches worth ₹9 lakh, iPhone and laptop were allegedly stolen from her Chennai home in October.

214.title: Actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi dies aged 46 while working out at gym
214.article_body: Actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi, known for his roles in shows like 'Kkusum', 'Waaris' and 'Suryaputra Karn', passed away on Friday at the age of 46. Actor Jay Bhanushali took to Instagram to condole the death of the actor and wrote, "Gone too soon". Speaking to Indian Express, Jay confirmed that Siddhaanth died after he collapsed at the gym.

215.title: Technical glitch on Hyderabad metro rectified after passengers report delays
215.article_body: Passengers travelling on the Hyderabad metro faced problems this morning after the services were stalled due to a technical glitch. Several trains were halted on the route from Miyapur to LB Nagar across various stations. Metro officials claimed that the problem cropped up due to a glitch at the Khairatabad station and that it has been rectified.

216.title: PM Modi stops car, stands on running board to greet crowd in B'luru
216.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday stopped his car at a key traffic junction in Bengaluru and greeted groups of people, many of whom were chanting "Modi, Modi". A video showed the PM waving at the crowd while standing on the running board of his car. Later, he tweeted, "Thank you Bengaluru for the memorable welcome to this dynamic city."

217.title: We talk about bowlers who can bat, but India need batters who can bowl: Kumble
217.article_body: Former Team India head coach Anil Kumble has said that the Indian team needs batters who can also contribute with the ball for the balance of the side. "That's exactly what England have. They had too many choices. They used Liam Livingstone. Moeen Ali has hardly bowled in this tournament. So those are the choices that you need," explained Kumble.

218.title: Amazon unveils new delivery drone capable of flying in rain
218.article_body: Amazon on Thursday unveiled the design of its next-generation delivery drone, MK30, which the company said will be smaller and lighter than its MK27-2 drone. The new drone will also have the ability to fly in light rain, it added. The company will use MK27-2 drone to make deliveries in California's Lockeford and Texas' College Station later this year.

219.title: Nykaa shares jump nearly 20% to the highest level in a month
219.article_body: Shares of Nykaa jumped 19.3% on Friday to the highest level in a month. The jump built on Thursday's closing gains of 6.5%, making Nykaa one of the best performers on S&P BSE Consumer Discretionary Index. The stock surge comes at a time when the company moved to time the bonus share issue with the expiry of the lock-in period.

220.title: Extremely difficult decisions needed for economic stability: UK
220.article_body: UK Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt said that "extremely difficult" decisions were required to restore confidence and economic stability in the country. "But to achieve long-term, sustainable growth, we need to grip inflation, balance the books and get debt falling. There's no other way," he added. This comes after official data showed UK's economy shrank by 0.2% in the third quarter.

221.title: No CEO above law, warns US FTC as several key Twitter executives resign
221.article_body: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) on Thursday said it's "tracking recent developments at Twitter with deep concern". "No CEO or company is above the law, and companies must follow our consent decrees," it added. FTC's remarks come after several key executives resigned from Twitter days after the platform's acquisition by Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

222.title: Heroin worth over ₹1 crore seized in Mumbai's Goregaon; 1 arrested
222.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly possessing 270 grams of heroin worth ₹1.09 crore from Goregaon in Mumbai. A police team saw the man moving suspiciously during patrolling, an official of the Dindoshi Police Station said. The man tried to run away on his bike when the police team approached him, after which he was apprehended, he added.

223.title: X-ray reveals bullet lodged in WW II veteran's neck for 77 years
223.article_body: An X-ray scan revealed a bullet lodged in a World War II veteran's neck for 77 years. Doctors in Shandong, China, found that Zhao He, 95, had a bullet lodged in his neck. Considering Zhao's age and the fact that the bullet has not caused any problems, it will not be removed as it can be risky.

224.title: Protest over dog bite incident ends in Ghaziabad as builder promises action
224.article_body: A protest being held by residents of Ghaziabad's Panchsheel Wellington society has ended after the builder promised to take action over dog bite incidents. This comes after a three-year-old child was bitten by a stray dog on Tuesday. Meanwhile, a resident filed a police complaint claiming that she and her daughter were roughed up by protesters while walking her dog.

225.title: Twitter will remove all blue tick badges in coming months: Musk
225.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk has said legacy blue tick badges will be dismantled in coming months as there are way too many corrupt verification checkmarks. He was responding to a Twitter user who said her actual verification was taken away after she signed up for Twitter Blue but it later reappeared. "Love when people complain about Twitter...on Twitter," Musk added.

226.title: If you can't perform hardcore, Twitter is not for you: Musk to staff in 1st meeting
226.article_body: Elon Musk hosted an all-hands meeting with Twitter employees at the company's headquarters for the first time since taking over and said, "If you can't perform hardcore, then Twitter is not for you." When an employee asked him why he ended remote work at Twitter, Musk looked "visibly annoyed" at the question and "shut her down", Business Insider reported.

227.title: If you can show up in office & you don't, resignation accepted: Musk to Twitter staff
227.article_body: During a meeting with Twitter employees, Elon Musk said that they will no longer be allowed to work remotely, The Verge reported. "Basically, if you can show up in an office and you do not show up at the office: resignation accepted. End of story," Musk said. He added that he won't ask employees to work "crazy hours" in office.

228.title: Glass palaces will fall if we decide to punish you: Iran to Saudi Arabia
228.article_body: Iran has told Saudi Arabia that there is no guarantee of the country continuing its "strategic patience". "If Iran decides to retaliate and punish, glass palaces will crumble and these countries will not experience stability anymore," Iran's Intelligence Minister Esmail Khatib said. This comes as Iran said that foreign enemies are behind the ongoing protests in the country.

229.title: Pune railway authorities send notice to school to vacate premises
229.article_body: Pune railway authorities have sent a notice to a school-cum-church in Ghorpadi to vacate its premises within 15 days as the land belongs to the railways. Following this, the school authorities held a meeting with students' parents and decided to fight the order. "We have all...documents related to...ownership of the land; the school was started in 1956," the principal said.

230.title: Twitter's Head of Trust & Safety Yoel Roth quits
230.article_body: Twitter's top executive Yoel Roth, who has been sharing updates about verification, impersonation, and harassment since Elon Musk took over, has resigned. Roth has changed his Twitter bio to "Former Head of Trust & Safety" at Twitter. Notably, Roth, who emerged as part of Musk's core leadership team, had tweeted about the platform's efforts to combat hateful conduct on Thursday.

231.title: Congress MLA booked for looting fertilisers in MP, calls FIR fake
231.article_body: Congress MLA Manoj Chawla and his associates have been booked in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam for allegedly looting fertilisers and obstructing government work. "MLA Chawla and his associates misbehaved with the staff…provoked people to loot fertilisers by opening shutter of the warehouse," said Ratlam's SP. On the other hand, Chawla has claimed that the FIR filed against him is fake.

232.title: 3-member panel constituted for framing children safety guidelines in T'gana
232.article_body: The Telangana government has constituted a three-member panel that will prepare guidelines for child safety in schools. The measures have been taken to prevent any untoward incidents against children in the foreseeable future. Earlier in October, a four-year-old girl was allegedly sexually abused by a school principal's driver in Banjara Hills. The accused has been arrested by the police.

233.title: Russia unwilling to discuss proposals on basketball player Griner's release: US
233.article_body: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan on Thursday said the US has put forward "a series of proposals" to Russia for the release of American basketball star Brittney Griner and ex-US Marine Paul Whelan. However, Russia hasn't shown a willingness to engage in productive talks, Sullivan added. Griner was arrested and jailed for nine years on drug possession charges.

234.title: Over ₹2 cr cash seized from car in Noida, 8 arrested
234.article_body: Noida Police has arrested eight men after over ₹2 crore cash was found in a car in the Sector 58 area on Thursday evening. “It is expected that ₹2 crore was being taken for the hawala network," said police. While three accused belong to Delhi, one each hails from Ahmedabad, Mumbai, Indore, West Bengal and Noida.

235.title: Denied ticket by BJP, sitting Gujarat MLA Kesarisinh joins AAP
235.article_body: Sitting BJP MLA for Matar Kesarisinh Solanki has joined the AAP ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections. This comes after the BJP named Kalpeshbhai Parmar as its candidate for the constituency instead of Solanki, who has won the seat twice. AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia welcomed Solanki to the party and called him a "popular, hardworking [and] fearless MLA".

236.title: Moody's cuts India's GDP growth forecast to 7% from 7.7% for 2022
236.article_body: Global credit rating agency Moody's Investors Service cut India's GDP growth projections for 2022 to 7% from 7.7%. "The downward revision assumes higher inflation, high-interest rates and slowing global growth will dampen economic momentum by more than we had previously expected," Moody's said. In September, it had cut projections for 2022 to 7.7% from 8.8% estimated in May.

237.title: Hema Malini dresses up as Radha to perform in Mathura stage show, shares pics
237.article_body: Actress Hema Malini took to Twitter to share pictures of herself dressed as Radha. Reports said that she dressed up as Radha to perform at a stage show in Mathura on the occasion of Kartik Purnima. In the pictures, she can be seen posing with someone dressed as Lord Krishna. She said the pictures are from evening of November 9.

238.title: Karthik-Pant issue, Ashwin's return to white-ball team should be questioned: Zaheer
238.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said certain decisions taken by the Team India management should be questioned following the team's semi-final exit from the ongoing T20 World Cup. "The DK-Pant scenario...Bringing Ashwin back is also something which they're going to have to look at," added Zaheer. "We've been getting stuck [in multi-nation tournaments] for a while now," he further said.

239.title: SC orders release of 6 convicts serving life term in Rajiv Gandhi assassination case
239.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered the release of six convicts, including Nalini Sriharan and RP Ravichandran, serving life term in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. Former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur on May 21, 1991. In May, the SC ordered the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the life convicts in the assassination case.

240.title: Gurmeet Choudhary & Debina Bonnerjee announce birth of 2nd daughter, share post
240.article_body: Actors Gurmeet Choudhary and Debina Bonnerjee on Friday announced the birth of their second daughter. "Welcome our baby girl into the world. As ecstatic as we are becoming parents again, we appreciate some privacy at this time as our baby has come into the world sooner than due," the post read. They welcomed their first daughter Lianna in April.

241.title: Accounts engaged in parody must include "parody" in their name: Musk
241.article_body: Twitter's new owner and billionaire Elon Musk said that accounts doing parody impersonations have to include "parody" in their name. Taking to the social media site, Musk tweeted, "Going forward, accounts engaged in parody must include "parody" in their name, not just in bio". "To be more precise, accounts doing parody impersonations. Basically, tricking people is not ok," he added.

242.title: Zomato shares gain the most in 3 months after Q2 results
242.article_body: Shares of Zomato gained 10%, surging the most in three months on lower-than-expected second-quarter loss. The food aggregator's consolidated net loss for the July-September quarter was ₹250.8 crore, compared to ₹185.7 crore in the previous three months. The company's revenue in the second quarter was up 17% at ₹1,661.3 crore which analysts projected at ₹1,558.3 crore.

243.title: Did I owe you money?: Jet Airways CEO as customer asks him to pay for cancelled ticket
243.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor responded to a Twitter user asking him to pay for their cancelled ticket and said, "Sorry, was I part of Jet 1.0 or did I personally owe you money?" He further told the user that if they followed the refund process defined by the NCLT after "Jet 1.0" suspended operations, they will receive the refund.

244.title: US wants to buy S Korean artillery shells to send to Ukraine: Official
244.article_body: The US wants to buy South Korean 155mm artillery shells to send to Ukraine amid the ongoing war, a US official said on Friday. However, South Korea's Defence Ministry said that its position of not providing lethal aid to Ukraine remains unchanged and that the negotiations are being conducted "under the premise that the US is the end user".

245.title: WhatsApp working on auto-mute feature for large group chats: Report
245.article_body: WhatsApp is working on an auto-mute feature for chats on large groups that have more than 256 participants, a WaBetaInfo report said. The Meta-owned company recently announced larger group chats with up to 1,024 participants. The report mentions that users will get an alert announcing that the group has been automatically muted. This will help reduce notifications.

246.title: 2 die as car jumps road divider, hits auto & 2-wheeler on Mumbai highway
246.article_body: Two people were killed while two others were injured after a car jumped a road divider and flung into north carriageway, following which, it hit an autorickshaw and a two-wheeler near the metro junction on Western Express Highway in Mumbai. Reports said driver of the car ran away from the spot of the accident. The auto driver and passenger died.

247.title: Trans woman cheated of around ₹12 lakh by live-in partner in Hyderabad
247.article_body: A Hyderabad based trans woman approached the Madhya Pradesh Police after she was cheated by her live-in partner of around ₹12 lakh. The victim had been living with Zuber for the last eight years, who hails from Burhanpur, MP. According to the victim, Zuber took all her money and jewellery while she was out of town in October.

248.title: Centre sanctioned ₹2,280 crore for food projects in Maha: Uday Samant
248.article_body: According to Maharashtra minister Uday Samant, the Center has sanctioned ₹2,280 crore for food processing projects in the state, which will create close to 30,000 jobs. "Be it food, leather, steel, footwear or electric vehicles, we have discussed various projects," said Samant. He also added that the state will be receiving more projects in the coming days.

249.title: What Byju & Divya want is not what BYJU'S wants: Co-founder on layoffs
249.article_body: While addressing YourStory's TechSparks event, BYJU'S Co-founder Divya Gokulnath spoke on layoffs and said "sometimes what Byju (Raveendran) and Divya want is not what BYJU'S as a company wants". BYJU'S laid off 2,500 employees to become more profitable. The company then announced signing of Lionel Messi, one of the world's highest paid footballers, as Global Brand Ambassador for an initiative.

250.title: Late Microsoft Co-founder's art collection sells for record $1.5 billion at auction
250.article_body: An art collection owned by late Microsoft Co-founder Paul Allen has sold for record $1.5 billion in the largest-ever art auction, said Christie's. Out of the 150 works of art auctioned, five paintings broke the $100 million mark. Georges Seurat's 1888 work 'Les Poseuses, Ensemble' sold for $149.2 million, making it the most expensive piece of art at the auction.

251.title: Record seizures made during ongoing Gujarat, Himachal Assembly polls: ECI
251.article_body: Record seizures have been made in the ongoing Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, the Election Commission of India (ECI) said in a press release on Friday. According to the press release, while Gujarat witnessed seizures worth ₹71.88 crore within "just a few days" of the poll announcement, seizures in Himachal Pradesh amounted to ₹50.28 crore.

252.title: WhatsApp posts video to explain difference between communities and groups
252.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp posted a video to explain the difference between communities and groups. "Use groups to have everyone join a single conversation. Use communities to bring related groups into one place," it said. It added that groups are used to connect with family and friends, whereas communities can be used to connect with schools, neighbourhoods and camps.

253.title: UK King Charles unveils 1st statue of Queen after her death
253.article_body: UK King Charles III recently unveiled the first statue of Queen Elizabeth II since her death on September 8 this year. The 6 feet and 7 inches statue has been unveiled outside York Minster in England's York. "Now her image will watch over what will become Queen Elizabeth Square for centuries to come," King Charles said.

254.title: Rupee rises the most in 4 years amid cooling US inflation
254.article_body: The rupee gained over 1.3% on Friday morning, registering its biggest jump in four years, and traded at 80.74 a dollar at 9:34 am. This was led by softer-than-expected US consumer price inflation boosting the odds of a slower rate hike by the US Federal Reserve. The rupee has surged in four out of the past five sessions.

255.title: PM unveils 108-ft bronze statue of Kempegowda in B'luru, video surfaces
255.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday unveiled the 108-feet tall bronze statue of Bengaluru's founder Nadaprabhu Kempegowda at the city's airport. Ninety-eight tonnes of bronze and 120 tonnes of steel were used to build the statue, which has been conceptualised by Ram V Sutar of 'Statue of Unity' fame, PMO said. It is called the 'Statue of Prosperity'.

256.title: NGO writes to Maha CM over auto drivers ogling at women via side mirrors
256.article_body: The Watchdog Foundation NGO has written to Maharashtra Chief Minister over the reports of autorickshaw drivers ogling at women passengers in the side view mirrors. "Drivers have started using bigger side view mirrors, not for viewing traffic but the passengers. This waywardness has to be dealt with an iron hand," the email to the Chief Minister read.

257.title: Man pushes wife's face in hot cooking oil in MP's Indore; arrested
257.article_body: A 46-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly pushed his wife's face into hot cooking oil, in which she was frying fritters, in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The police said that the incident occurred after the man drank alcohol and then later vomited, following which, he got furious suspecting that his wife gave him de-addiction pills, according to a report.

258.title: 9 dead, including 4 women, after armed men open fire in Mexico
258.article_body: Five men and four women were killed after gunmen burst into a bar and opened fire in the Mexican state of Guanajuato, authorities said on Thursday. Two women were injured in the attack. The attack is reportedly the third such bar massacre in as many months in Guanajuato, where a local gang is fighting a turf war with Jalisco cartel.

259.title: Man who stabbed girlfriend to death dies by suicide in Pune
259.article_body: A man who was accused of stabbing his girlfriend to death in the parking lot of her housing society this week died by alleged suicide, police officials in Pune said on Thursday. A case of accidental death has been registered at Paud police station. The man allegedly stabbed his girlfriend after their intended marriage broke off.

260.title: Egypt-based fintech firm Blnk raises $32 million in funding round
260.article_body: Egypt-based fintech platform Blnk has secured $32 million in one of the country's biggest funding rounds for a startup this year, CEO Amr Sultan told Reuters. Blnk raised $23.7 million in equity and debt funding and $8.3 million in securitised bond issuance. The combined pre-seed, seed rounds of $12.5 million were led by Emirates International Investment Company and Sawari Ventures.

261.title: Rains trigger waterlogging in Chennai, schools shut in several districts
261.article_body: Waterlogging was reported in several areas of Chennai on Friday after heavy rainfall in the last few hours. Schools will remain closed on Friday in several districts of Tamil Nadu, including Chennai, Tiruvallur, Sivaganga, Madurai and Dindigul. Meanwhile, Puducherry CM N Rangasamy has declared a holiday for schools and colleges in view of heavy rains.

262.title: PT teacher sexually assaults 15 students, kisses them during class in B'luru; arrested
262.article_body: A 54-year-old physical training teacher of a government school in Bengaluru has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting at least 15 students for nearly three months, police said. The incident came to light after the students of classes 8 and 9 informed their parents. They accused him of inappropriately touching and kissing them during classes and lunch breaks.

263.title: 5,00,000 people quit UK jobs since 2019 citing long-term illness: ONS
263.article_body: Nearly 5,00,000 more people, who have dropped out of Britain's job market since 2019, now cite a long-term illness or mental health problems, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said. "This rise in long-term sickness started before the COVID-19 pandemic, but since...early 2020, the number of people out of work because of long-term sickness has risen by 3,63,000," ONS said.

264.title: Expect 80-hr work weeks & fewer perks like free food, Musk told Twitter staff: Report
264.article_body: Elon Musk issued several warnings to Twitter employees during his first address to them on Thursday since taking over the company. Musk asked employees to brace for 80-hour work weeks and to expect fewer office perks like free food, Bloomberg reported. Musk also told employees that bankruptcy is a possibility for Twitter if it does not start generating more cash.

265.title: Karnataka CM Bommai urges govt staff to work one hour more daily
265.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday urged government staffers to work one hour more daily. He also assured government employees of suitable remuneration, saying, "You all must work with honesty, dedication and loyalty. Leave the rest to me." Bommai was attending a Karnataka State Government Employees Association event where he was felicitated for constituting the 7th pay commission.

266.title: My clock to leave US has started: Indian Meta employee after being fired
266.article_body: An Indian Meta employee in the United States, who was fired, shared a picture of his sons and wrote, "My clock to leave USA has started today...help me find a job in otherwise I have to leave USA with my kids." "My sons are US citizens, and their lives will be impacted," Raju Kadam added.

267.title: Fired Indian Meta employee in US shares sons' pic, says 'Their lives will be impacted'
267.article_body: An Indian Meta employee in the United States, who was fired, shared a picture of his sons and wrote, "My clock to leave USA has started today...help me find a job in otherwise I have to leave USA with my kids." "My sons are US citizens, and their lives will be impacted," Raju Kadam added.

268.title: India scored 38 runs in 6 overs, where did the attacking template go: Aakash
268.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said India's attacking approach was missing when they "needed it the most" in their T20 World Cup semi-final match against England. "You scored 38 in six overs. So where did the template go? You played run-a-ball. The intent was not there," stated Aakash. "It was a 200-run pitch and we stopped at 168," he added.

269.title: Students miss school after being stuck in traffic for 2.5 hrs in B'luru
269.article_body: Nearly 100 students missed school on Wednesday after they were stuck in traffic on the 2-km stretch of Bengaluru's Panathur RUB (railway under bridge) junction for over two and a half hours. Reportedly, several students started crying. Later that evening, parents and students held a candlelight march asking the Karnataka government, headed by CM Basavaraj S Bommai, to expand roads.

270.title: Thane civic body takes action against two people for urinating in open
270.article_body: Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) took action against two people for urinating in the open on Wednesday. While TMC Commissioner Abhijit Bhangar was inspecting the city, he saw two people in two different locations urinating in the open. He immediately directed the officials to fine them on the spot. Recently, he ordered strict action against people who indulge in wrongful activities.

271.title: Twitter adds 'Official' tag to some verified accounts days after Musk 'killed' it
271.article_body: Twitter's new grey-coloured 'Official' tag reappeared for some prominent and verified accounts on Friday. Twitter launched the new label earlier this week, however, its new owner Elon Musk "killed" it hours after it began appearing on some Twitter accounts on Wednesday. Meanwhile, Twitter on Thursday said it was pausing the label but it is "aggressively going after impersonation and deception".

272.title: Vote to make Himachal Pradesh no.1 state: Amit Shah
272.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah requested the people of Himachal Pradesh to vote the BJP back to power in the upcoming Assembly polls and asked them to cast their votes to make the state number one in the country. "Congress is not a democratic party. It is a party born out of dynasty," said Shah.

273.title: Overselling to investors is like a treadmill: Zerodha CEO to founders
273.article_body: While speaking at YourStory's TechSparks event, Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath said overselling to investors is like a treadmill. "Now that you have taken money from someone saying you are worth a billion dollars, how do you keep justifying it? It's like a treadmill," Kamath said, adding that a cycle of hyper-funding and hyper-valuation puts additional pressure on entrepreneurs.

274.title: PM Modi inaugurates Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru
274.article_body: PM Modi on Friday inaugurated Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru. Reports said that the terminal has been built at a cost of ₹5,000 crore, adding that with the new terminal's inauguration, the airport will be able to handle passengers better as check-in and immigration counters will double. The airport also issued advisory in view of VIP movement.

275.title: Noose found at Obama Presidential Center construction site in Chicago
275.article_body: A noose was discovered at the Obama Presidential Center construction site in Chicago on Thursday. Condemning the incident, Illinois Governor JB Pritzker said, "The noose is more than a symbol of racism, it is a heart-stopping reminder of the violence and terror inflicted on Black Americans for centuries." The Chicago Police Department has launched an investigation into the incident.

276.title: 33-yr-old Mumbai man loses ₹60 lakh in Ludo, held at gunpoint to pay amount
276.article_body: A 33-year-old man was held at gunpoint by four people after he allegedly lost ₹60 lakh in an online game of Ludo in Mumbai. Reports said that the four accused had made him drink alcohol. One of the accused robbed him of cash and gold accessories. The accused threatened to kill him if he failed to pay the entire amount.

277.title: If you miss a call from her, then you're done: Amitabh Bachchan on wife Jaya
277.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said that according to his actress-wife Jaya Bachchan, he has to be present whenever she calls. "If she calls and you miss the call, then you are done...I told my secretary to receive her calls and give her my information...She would tell me, 'So now to talk to you, I've to go through your secretary?'," he added.

278.title: Mercedes F1 team retains FTX branding amid crypto exchange crisis
278.article_body: Mercedes Formula One team said they are retaining cryptocurrency exchange FTX's branding on their cars at this weekend's Sao Paulo Grand Prix in Brazil, however, they're watching the developments closely. FTX is reportedly scrambling to raise about $9.4 billion from investors and rivals. After Binance cancelled its acquisition, FTX CEO told his staff that he was seeking a capital raise.

279.title: Fire breaks out near flower market in Hyderabad; no casualty reported
279.article_body: A fire broke out in a house due to a short circuit near Gudimalkapur flower market in Hyderabad. Reports have confirmed that the blaze started due to a short circuit in the building. "Fire broke out in a watchmen's house in the apartment...no casualty reported. Around four to five bikes were burnt, fire brigade...doused the fire," said a police officer.

280.title: Twitter's top exec resigns, then agrees to stay after Musk persuades her: Report
280.article_body: Twitter's top sales executive Robin Wheeler has agreed to stay at the company, shortly after she decided to quit, Bloomberg reported on Friday. As per reports, Twitter's new owner and CEO Elon Musk persuaded Wheeler not to resign. Meanwhile, the company's head of trust and safety Yoel Roth, who was part of Musk's new leadership team, has also resigned.

281.title: 5 houses gutted after fire breaks out in slum area in Pune
281.article_body: At least five houses were gutted after a fire broke out in the slum area in Pune's Wanwadi on Thursday, officials said. Police said that no casualties were reported and efforts are being made to ascertain the cause of the fire which, prima facie, appears to have occurred due to a short circuit. Some residents were shifted to safer spots.

282.title: We leave Australian shores with disappointment in our hearts: Kohli on India's T20 WC exit
282.article_body: Following India's exit from T20 World Cup 2022, Virat Kohli penned a note on Instagram, writing, "We leave Australian shores short of achieving our dream and with disappointment in our hearts." He added, "[But] we can take back...lot of memorable moments as a group and aim to get better from here on." He also expressed gratitude to fans for support.

283.title: Suryakumar pens note after India's exit from T20 WC 2022, says 'So close, yet so far'
283.article_body: World number one T20I batter Suryakumar Yadav penned a note after India crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "Hurtful loss...Grateful to our fans who create electrifying atmosphere...no matter where in the world we are. Thankful and proud of...unending support for each other and the hard work put in by this team and support staff."

284.title: Pak journalist Sharif was tortured before being shot dead in Kenya: Report
284.article_body: Arshad Sharif, a senior Pakistani journalist who was killed in Kenya, was "brutally tortured" for hours before being shot dead, a local media report said, citing post-mortem reports. The media report claimed that the journalist's fingernails were pulled out and his fingers and ribs were broken during torture. Sharif was shot dead on October 23 on the outskirts of Nairobi.

285.title: Chris Evans dating 25-year-old Portuguese actress Alba Baptista: Report
285.article_body: Actor Chris Evans, 41, is dating 25-year-old Portuguese actress Alba Baptista, who starred in 'Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris', for over a year, People magazine reported quoting sources. "They are in love and Chris has never been happier. His family and friends all adore her," the source said. Evans was recently named the 'Sexiest Man Alive' by People magazine.

286.title: Students on hunger strike over Jogeshwari hostel's condition in Mumbai
286.article_body: Students residing at the Jogeshwari boys' hostel, Mumbai have been on a hunger strike for the last four days against the decision to shift them to faraway locations due to the dilapidated situation of the building. The social welfare department informed students to move to its hostels in Kandivali, Kalyan, etc. However, students are demanding to live in close quarters.

287.title: Provide electricity to Hindu refugees from Pak in 30 days: Delhi HC
287.article_body: A division bench of the Delhi High Court on Thursday directed Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited to provide electricity to Hindu refugees from Pakistan, living in Adarsh Nagar near Majlis Park Metro station, within 30 days. The order came after the Centre submitted that it has given approval for the installation of electricity connection for the refugees.

288.title: Ghaziabad man walks to SSP office, says he murdered wife; threw body in park
288.article_body: A Ghaziabad man was taken into custody after he walked to the office of the Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) in Rajnagar and said that he had murdered his own wife and thrown her body in a park. Reports said that the body was recovered. The man is being questioned, police said.

289.title: PM Modi flags off Mysuru-Chennai Vande Bharat train in Bengaluru
289.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday flagged off the Mysuru-Chennai Vande Bharat train at the Krantivira Sangolli Rayanna Railway Station in Bengaluru. This is the first Vande Bharat train in South India while fifth in India overall. The semi-high-speed train will cover distance of 500 km between the cities in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu in six hours and 30 minutes.

290.title: Oscar winner Paul Haggis loses rape case, ordered to pay over ₹60 crore in US
290.article_body: A jury in the US ordered Oscar-winning filmmaker Paul Haggis to pay at least $7.5 million (over ₹60 crore) to publicist Haleigh Breest who accused him of rape. The jury also decided that additional punitive damages should be awarded, but the amount would be decided later. Haggis is known for writing best picture Oscar winners Million Dollar Baby and Crash.

291.title: India playing white-ball cricket that's dated and have done for years: Vaughan
291.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has criticised India's batting approach, stating that they're "playing a white-ball game that's dated and have done for years". He added, "India can hide behind their great players but it's about getting a team playing the right way as a whole." India crashed out of the 2022 T20 WC after losing to England in the semi-final.

292.title: Gurugram man stuck in toll plaza queue destroys booths, hits staff with bat
292.article_body: A man was arrested after he vandalised 17 toll booths and hit toll plaza staff with a wooden bat after he was stuck in a queue at the plaza. The man had been exempted from paying toll as he is a resident of Naurangpur village near the plaza. Police said the man has been involved in similar incidents earlier too.

293.title: FTX CEO seeks to raise $9.4 bn in rescue package for firm: Report
293.article_body: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is reportedly looking to raise up to $9.4 billion in a rescue package for his company, which is facing a liquidity crunch. He is discussing raising funds from multiple investors including crypto firm Tether and crypto exchange OKX, Reuters reported. Bankman-Fried has resisted filing for bankruptcy and refused to appoint restructuring advisers, the report stated.

294.title: Police officer stabbed to death in Brussels; attacker neutralised
294.article_body: A knife-wielding man attacked and killed a police officer and injured another in Brussels on Thursday. Police are looking into the act as possibly a terrorist attack, judicial officials said. The suspected attacker was shot and "neutralised". Belgian PM Alexander De Croo condemned the attack and said it showed the kind of risk police officers face in their jobs.

295.title: SaaS startup Spintly raises $2.5 million in a pre-Series A funding
295.article_body: Spintly, a software-as-a-service-based (SaaS)﻿ startup, raised $2.5 million in a pre-Series A funding round that saw participation from LetsVenture, AccelNest, SucSEED Indovation, RiSo Capital, Defang Technology, 91 Ventures, KYTO Technology & Life Science and angel investors, including Dheeraj Pandey, Co-founder and CEO of DevRev. Spintly was started by Rohin Parkar and Malcolm Dsouza.

296.title: Blast at firecracker factory leaves 3 dead in Andhra; rescue ops on
296.article_body: At least three people were killed in an explosion at a firecracker manufacturing unit in Andhra Pradesh's West Godavari on Thursday. There is no clarity on the number of people injured in the incident as rescue operations are ongoing, police officials said. State CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy announced ₹10 lakh compensation for the families of the deceased.

297.title: Explosive-like device found in riverbed under bridge in Maharashtra
297.article_body: An explosive-like device was found in the riverbed under a bridge on the Mumbai-Goa highway in Maharashtra's Raigad on Thursday, a police official said. The police official added that there were two bunches of six gelatin sticks each, attached to an electric circuit and a watch. The device has been defused after being removed from the riverbed.

298.title: Indian cricket was exposed in semi-final, it is at its lowest right now: Shoaib Akhtar
298.article_body: Following India's exit from T20 World Cup 2022, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "Their cricket was exposed [in the semi-final against England]." He added, "Indian cricket, I think, is at the lowest right now because when it comes to ICC events, India will need to look at their captaincy, the management will need to take the blame."

299.title: Portugal announce their squad for 2022 FIFA WC, Ronaldo to feature in his 5th WC
299.article_body: Portugal have announced their squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup, with Cristiano Ronaldo set to feature in his fifth FIFA World Cup. The squad also includes 19-year-old Antonio Silva, who is yet to play an international match. Porto's 39-year-old defender Pepe has also been included and he's set to play in his fourth World Cup.

300.title: He had entire office at my audition, asked what they thought: Sunny on Anurag
300.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone, while speaking about the film that she has been working on with filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, said that he had his entire office at her audition. "It was a sea of women, himself and some men from his team. As I finished the audition, he asked each of them what they thought of my performance," she added.

301.title: Automovill raises ₹2.15 crore led by Inflection Point Ventures
301.article_body: Automovill, a vehicle services startup, has secured ₹2.15 crore in pre-Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The company was founded by Mridu Das, Chinmay Baruah, who were later joined by Ramana Sambu as a Co-founder. In 2021, Automovill raised an undisclosed amount from Angel Bay in October and $500,000 from Mumbai Angels Network and others in July.

302.title: Taliban bans women from gyms and parks in Afghanistan
302.article_body: The Taliban has banned women from using gyms and going to parks in Afghanistan, officials said. Taliban's spokesperson Mohammed Akef Mohajer said the ban was being introduced because people were ignoring gender segregation orders and women were not wearing the required headscarf or hijab. Women have also been banned from funfairs, according to reports.

303.title: Putin not attending G20 summit over 'big possibility of assassination attempt': Reports
303.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is not attending the G20 summit in Indonesia as there is a "big possibility of an assassination attempt on him from special services of US, Britain and Ukraine", according to reports quoting Russian political strategist Sergey Markov. Markov also suggested a scenario where Putin might be subjected to "humiliating situations" during the summit.

304.title: Sensex gains over 800 points, Nifty above 18,200 in opening trade
304.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Friday amid positive global cues as US inflation slows down. Sensex gained 827.54 points to open at 61,441.24, while Nifty was up 241 points at 18,269.20. Tech Mahindra, Wipro, Infosys, HCL Technologies and Apollo Hospitals were among the major gainers on Nifty, while the stock of Eicher Motors slipped.

305.title: Priest drugs, rapes 15-year-old boy he met on dating app in France
305.article_body: A priest working in France has been accused of drugging and raping a 15-year-old boy he met on gay dating app Grindr, prosecutors said. The priest has been arrested and charged with "aggravated rape of a teenager" and "provocation of a minor to use narcotics". This comes days after 11 former or serving French bishops were accused of sexual violence.

306.title: Adani Group, RIL, 13 others bid for Future Retail's assets: Report
306.article_body: Adani Group, Reliance Industries and 13 other firms have entered the fray to acquire the assets of Future Retail (FRL), Reuters reported. Shalimar Corporation, Nalwa Steel & Power, United Biotech and WHSmith Travel are among other entities to have submitted expressions of interest. Future Retail was dragged into bankruptcy proceedings after its lenders rejected a $3.4-billion sale of assets.

307.title: You don't have to buy a new iPhone every year: iPhone co-creator
307.article_body: iPhone co-creator Tony Fadell said that people don't need to buy the latest generation of the Apple phone each year. During an event by YourStory, the former Apple executive, who himself uses an iPhone 12, said that computers and mobile phones reach a technological pinnacle at some point. He added, "The iPod...may be gone, but it will never be forgotten."

308.title: Russia has become more brutal, disciplined under new commander: Ukraine
308.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said Russian army under General Sergei Surovikin has become more disciplined and brutal. Reznikov added that Surovikin is now using "terrorism tactics" against civilians and infrastructure objects using rocket missiles and special Iranian drones. Russia now sends 40 rockets to Ukraine compared to one or two before, he stated.

309.title: He took a chopper; I walked: Rahul on meeting an RSS leader in Kedarnath
309.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recalled meeting an RSS leader in Kedarnath. Rahul said he walked while the leader came via a chopper. He added the leader weighed around 100 kilograms and they asked each other what they had asked from God. Rahul said while the RSS leader asked for health, he himself only thanked God for showing him the path.

310.title: 4 minors assault man with glass bottle during robbery bid in Pune
310.article_body: Four minors allegedly assaulted a man with a glass bottle after he resisted when they threatened him and demanded cash from him in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad, police officials said on Thursday. According to the man's father, his son was on his way to work when the incident took place. Two of the minors have been detained, a police sub-inspector said.

311.title: Few seats left for batch 15 of IIM-Indore’s IPBA program: UNext Jigsaw
311.article_body: The seats are filling fast for the 15th batch of IIM Indore's IPBA program as per UNext Jigsaw. The 10-month online program is taught by IIM faculty and industry leaders covering core concepts with 10+ graded assignments, case studies and capstone project. It highlighted that 86% of program participants have boosted their careers with a 48% average hike in salary.

312.title: 3 thrash restaurant staffer over delayed biryani order in Noida, video surfaces
312.article_body: Three men were caught on camera thrashing a staff member of a restaurant in Ansal mall in Greater Noida after their order for biryani was allegedly delayed on Thursday. All three accused are residents of Dadri and have been arrested, ADCP Vishal Pandey said. The clip shows the men dragging the staffer out of the restaurant and beating him.

313.title: BARC scientist tries to secure MBBS seat for daughter, loses ₹12.66 lakh
313.article_body: A Bhabha Atomic Research Centre scientist was robbed of ₹12.66 lakh while allegedly trying to secure an MBBS seat for his daughter at Kempegowda Institute of Medical Sciences in Bengaluru. A police officer said that the complainant met the accused at the institute where they promised him to secure a seat for his daughter under the management quota.

314.title: Student allegedly harassed over school fees dies by suicide in Ghaziabad
314.article_body: A Class 8 student died by alleged suicide at his home in Ghaziabad with his father alleging that he was harassed by his school for failing to pay the fees, police said on Thursday. However, the school claimed he possibly took the step as he was directed to inform his father about a fight he had with his classmate.

315.title: India have never won a T20 World Cup since introduction of IPL: Wasim Akram
315.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that India have never won a T20 World Cup since the introduction of IPL. "Everyone thought the IPL will be the big difference between India and other teams," he added. India won the inaugural edition of T20 World Cup in 2007, while the first season of IPL took place in 2008.

316.title: There will be some retirements, you never know: Gavaskar on India's exit from T20 WC 2022
316.article_body: Reacting to India's exit from T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said, "There will be some retirements also coming through...you never know." He added, "This isn't...time to think about it. You really get away from it...give it a lot of thought...but there are a lot of players in their mid-30s who'd consider their position for India's T20I team."

317.title: Van being chased by cow vigilantes overturns in Gurugram; 3 injured
317.article_body: Three suspected cattle rustlers were injured after their speeding van overturned while being chased by cow vigilantes in Gurugram, police said. The police added that there were six alleged rustlers and they pushed cows off the vehicle in a bid to stop the vigilantes. Three suspects managed to escape while the other three were arrested, a police official said.

318.title: India is our number 1 priority, will reduce waiting time for visa by mid-2023: US
318.article_body: Speaking about the long waiting period for visa, a senior US embassy official said, "India is number one priority for Washington. Our aim is to bring the situation to the pre-Covid-19 level by the middle of next year." The official said that the country is also planning to hire more personnel and increase the "drop box" facilities.

319.title: Relations with China cannot be normal unless there is peace in border areas: India
319.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said India's relationship with China cannot be normal unless there is peace in the border areas. Referring to the Galwan Valley clash, Jaishankar said what happened in 2020 was an "attempt by one party, and we know which one, to depart from agreements and understandings and that is at the heart of the issue".

320.title: Coinbase fires over 60 workers in its 2nd round of layoffs this year
320.article_body: Crypto exchange Coinbase Global has cut more than 60 jobs in its recruiting and institutional onboarding teams, according to a spokesperson of the company. This comes a week after Coinbase reported a third-quarter net loss of $545 million, citing "stronger macroeconomic and crypto market headwinds". The company cut about 1,100 jobs, or 18% of its workforce, in June.

321.title: Mumbai Police rescue 1-day-old girl from being sold for ₹1 lakh, 2 held
321.article_body: The crime branch of Mumbai Police on Wednesday rescued a one-day-old girl after receiving a tip-off that she was going to be sold for ₹1 lakh. Two women were arrested in the case. "The Mumbai police has been successful in rescuing five infants from being sold within a span of two months," Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) zone one, said.

322.title: Apple adds $191 billion in market cap in biggest 1-day gain in US market history
322.article_body: World's most valuable company Apple added $190.9 billion in market value on Thursday, the most ever by a listed company in the US. The company now holds a market capitalisation of $2.34 trillion and accounts for four out of the top five biggest daily gains. Apple broke the previous record set by Amazon's $190.8 billion gain in February, Bloomberg reported.

323.title: Twitter may face bankruptcy, says Musk in first meeting with staff: Report
323.article_body: Elon Musk held a meeting with Twitter employees for the first time on Thursday, two weeks after he acquired the social media company. During the meeting, the billionaire reportedly raised the possibility of Twitter going bankrupt. In an email to employees earlier, Musk had asked employees to prepare for "difficult times ahead", noting that the "economic picture ahead is dire".

324.title: Railway lines between Mumbai's CSMT-Masjid Bunder to be closed for 27 hrs
324.article_body: Central Railway has announced that all six railway lines between Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and Masjid Bunder will remain closed for 27 hours from November 19. Central Railway said services will be affected as it'll be dismantling/demolishing the dilapidated Carnac Bridge. The disruption will begin from 11 pm on November 19 and end at 2 am on November 21.

325.title: Men enter Delhi woman's home to drink water, steal gold jewellery & cash
325.article_body: A group of men allegedly barged into a woman's home in Delhi's Rohini on Wednesday night and robbed her of gold jewellery and cash after threatening her. Police said the suspects barged into the 52-year-old widow's house on the pretext of drinking water and asking for other items. The woman, who runs a grocery shop, lives alone at her house.

326.title: German Shepherd attacks, bites security guard at Greater Noida society; video surfaces
326.article_body: A pet dog, German Shepherd, attacked and bit a security guard at a Greater Noida housing society. A CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online. In the footage, the dog can be seen lunging at the guard and taking hold of his arm, while its owner can be seen trying to drive it away with the help of stick.

327.title: Mumbai-Pune Expressway missing link project 60% complete
327.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation has said that the "missing link" project on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway has attained 60% progress. The project, which includes a viaduct and a cable-stayed bridge, will also have a 10.55-km-long tunnel, a part of which is being constructed over 100 metres below Lonavala lake. The project is targeted to be completed by December 2023.

328.title: Ex-Andaman & Nicobar Chief Secy Narain arrested in gangrape case
328.article_body: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) on Thursday arrested former Andaman and Nicobar Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain in a gangrape case, hours after his anticipatory bail application was rejected. The SIT was formed to probe allegations that a 21-year-old woman was raped on pretext of job by top officials at Narain's home. He had earlier rejected the allegations, calling them "absurd".

329.title: Students in Bengal clash with police after 17-yr-old dies in wall collapse
329.article_body: Violent clashes erupted between students and police in West Bengal's Malda on Thursday after a 17-year-old boy died and his friend was injured in a school wall collapse. A total of seven police officials were injured and four students were arrested following clashes. Tear gas shells were fired to bring situation under control and further investigation is underway, police said.

330.title: Dalit converts to Christianity, Islam can't get Schedule Caste status: Centre to SC
330.article_body: Centre on Wednesday told the Supreme Court that Scheduled Caste (SC) status hasn't been granted to Dalits who converted to Islam or Christianity because untouchability isn't prevalent in these two religions. The constitutional right to reservations in jobs and education as a member of the SC community is currently extended to people from Hindu, Sikh or Buddhist faiths.

331.title: Forbes enters into advanced talks with investor group for sale of business
331.article_body: Forbes CEO Mike Federle confirmed that the company is in advanced talks to sell itself to a group of investors. Forbes had been seeking at least $800 million in a sale, but final price would likely be less, The New York Times reported. The move comes months after the publisher pulled out of a deal to go public.

332.title: England announce squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup
332.article_body: England on Thursday announced their squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup, which will begin in Qatar on November 20. England have included James Maddison and Callum Wilson, who had last played for England in 2019. Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford has also been included in the squad. England will begin their World Cup group campaign against Iran on November 21.

333.title: B'luru Cong leaders brandish swords during Tipu Jayanti celebration
333.article_body: Several local Congress leaders were seen brandishing swords during Tipu Jayanti celebration in Bengaluru on Thursday. Chamrajpet MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan was seen leading a procession while sitting on a horse and brandishing a sword. He also addressed the media while holding the sword. This comes despite a ban on use of weapons during such events.

334.title: Jet Airways relaunch may be delayed over unfulfilled payments: Report
334.article_body: The relaunch of Jet Airways is likely to be delayed as Jalan Kalrock consortium, the airline's winning bidder, is yet to fulfill its payments. Jalan Kalrock has to make two payments, one to the erstwhile airline staff and the other to various lenders. The ownership of the airline will be transferred only after the first payment to the lenders.

335.title: Scientists reconstruct face of 'world's first' pregnant ancient Egyptian mummy
335.article_body: Forensic scientists have reconstructed the face of the 'world's first' pregnant ancient Egyptian mummy more than 2,000 years after her death, using 2D and 3D techniques. The mummy known as 'The Mystery Lady' is believed to have died 28 weeks into her pregnancy, aged between 20-30. The mummy was discovered and taken out of Egypt into Warsaw, Poland in 1826.

336.title: Too early to talk about it: Rahul Dravid on future of India's senior players in T20Is
336.article_body: Following India's exit from T20 World Cup 2022, head coach Rahul Dravid was asked in press conference as to what would be the future of senior players including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in T20Is. Dravid said, "It's too early to talk about it." He added, "These guys have been terrific performers...We've got...a couple of years to reflect on it."

337.title: Imran Khan’s party restarts march, days after assassination bid
337.article_body: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan's 'Haqeeqi Azadi' (freedom in reality) march restarted on Thursday, days after a failed assassination bid on Khan's life. Thousands of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party supporters gathered at the same site in Wazirabad where the assassination attempt was made to restart the march. Khan, who has been advised rest, addressed his supporters via a video message.

338.title: 23-year-old Indian-American Nabeela Syed makes history in US midterm elections
338.article_body: A 23-year-old Indian-American woman has scripted history in the US midterm elections. Nabeela Syed has become the youngest member to get elected to the Illinois General Assembly. She defeated her Republican opponent Chris Bos. Born in Palatine, Illinois, Syed graduated from the University of California with a degree in Political Science and Business.

339.title: 100,000 Russian soldiers dead or wounded in Ukraine war: US
339.article_body: US Joint Chiefs of Staff, Army Gen. Mark Milley on Wednesday said "well over" 100,000 Russian soldiers have either died or have been injured in the ongoing Ukraine war. He added that the Ukrainian side may have suffered a similar number in casualties. Milley said the winter-induced stalemate in fighting is a good opportunity for peace negotiations.

340.title: British Sikh military personnel get special prayer book
340.article_body: A waterproof prayer book with "tactical" hymns has been launched for British Sikh soldiers to carry with them onto the battlefield. The Nitnem Gutka Sahib was handed over to military personnel recently at the Central Gurdwara Khalsa Jatha in London. "This is not something new, but a reintroduction of a tradition," said the Defence Sikh Network UK.

341.title: NPS money belongs to employees, can't go back to state govts: FM Sitharaman
341.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said the money in the National Pension Scheme (NPS) belongs to contributing workers and according to the law, state governments cannot get it back. This came after Congress-ruled states have sought money from Centre for reintroducing old pension scheme (OPS). "Can we change the law? It's workers' money in the central kitty," Sitharaman added.

342.title: What multiple records did Virat Kohli break today with his 50(40) against England?
342.article_body: With his 50(40) against England today, Virat Kohli became the first cricketer to score 4,000 T20I runs. He became the first Indian to hit 100 fours in T20 World Cups. Kohli has slammed most 50-plus scores (22) in World Cups (ODI and T20I), overtaking Sachin Tendulkar (21). He's now the highest international run-scorer among visiting batters in Adelaide (957 runs).

343.title: US Prez Biden, China's Xi set for in-person meet in Indonesia
343.article_body: US President Joe Biden will have a face-to-face meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday on the sidelines of the G20 Summit in Indonesia, the White House announced. This is set to be the first in-person meeting between Biden and Xi since Biden became president. The White House said discussions will focus on trade, Taiwan and the Russia-Ukraine war.

344.title: Centre approves ₹13,000-crore advance for PM Awas Yojna
344.article_body: The Union Finance Ministry has approved ₹13,000-crore in advance payment for the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojna-Gramin (PMAY-G). The decision was made after the Union Ministry of Rural Development had flagged shortage of funds to implement the rural housing scheme. The ₹13,000-crore advance is over and above the ₹20,000-crore already provided for the scheme in the 2022-23 Budget.

345.title: 5 killed after blast in cracker manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu
345.article_body: Five workers were killed and several were injured after an explosion took place at a firecracker manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Madurai district on Thursday, officials said. According to an official release, the unit was located in Azhagusirai village near Tirumangalam in the district. CM MK Stalin announced ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh to the families of the deceased.

346.title: What records were broken during India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final today?
346.article_body: England's Jos Buttler and Alex Hales broke record for highest partnership ever in a T20 World Cup match after sharing a 170*-run stand against India in the semi-final today. Hales broke the record for smashing most sixes (seven) in a T20 WC knockout match. England became the first team to win an ICC event semi-final or final by 10 wickets.

347.title: Amazon begins monthslong cost-cutting review: Report
347.article_body: US e-commerce giant Amazon has begun a monthslong cost-cutting review focused on unprofitable business units, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday. Employees in certain unprofitable divisions have been told to look for jobs elsewhere in the company as the teams they were working in were being suspended or closed. Notably, Amazon's stock is down about 45% year to date.

348.title: India on the path to reclaim past glory: Vice Prez Dhankar
348.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday said India is rising and is on the path to "reclaim the glory" it enjoyed years ago.
