Dhankar was speaking at the centenary celebrations of Delhi University. "I congratulate the Delhi University for completing 100 years. It is a milestone in the journey of any organisation," he said.

349.title: Exit polls banned for Guj, Himachal elections between Nov 12 & Dec 5
349.article_body: The Election Commission has banned exit polls for the Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh elections between November 12 and December 5. Elections in Himachal Pradesh will be held on November 12 across 68 constituencies. In Gujarat, the elections will take place in two phases on December 1 and 5. The counting of votes for both the states is on December 8.

350.title: Russian assets worth over £18 billion have been frozen: Britain
350.article_body: The British government on Thursday said it has frozen assets worth over £18 billion of Russian oligarchs and businesses over the Ukrainian invasion by Moscow. Now, Russia has become Britain's most-sanctioned nation, overtaking Libya and Iran, the Office of Financial Sanctions Implementation said in an annual report. The UK has also sanctioned 95% of all Russian exports.

351.title: Which major tech companies have announced layoffs in 2022?
351.article_body: Meta, which fired over 11,000 employees, is the latest among major tech companies to announce layoffs this year. Earlier, Twitter's new owner Elon Musk fired about 3,700 employees, and in October, Microsoft reportedly cut nearly 1,000 jobs. Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs, Lyft cut 700 jobs, Stripe fired 1,100 employees, Netflix fired 450 employees, and Snap laid off 1,000 employees.

352.title: Pic of Shiva Linga created with gym equipment in MP goes viral
352.article_body: An old picture of a Shiva Linga created with gym equipment including weight plates and dumbbells has gone viral on social media. A Twitter handle named Colours of Bharat, which shared the picture, said the structure was created by a gym owner in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. The picture showed the Shiva Linga adorned with garlands of marigold flowers.

353.title: Twitter Chief Information Security Officer Lea Kissner resigns
353.article_body: Twitter's Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) Lea Kissner announced that she is leaving the company. Calling it a "hard decision", Kissner tweeted, "I'm so proud of the privacy, security, and IT teams and the work we've done." Kissner, who joined Twitter last year, was promoted to CISO in January 2022 following the departure of security head Peiter "Mudge" Zatko.

354.title: Anticipatory bail plea of ex-Andaman Chief Secy Narain rejected
354.article_body: A Sessions Court on Thursday dismissed the anticipatory bail application of former Andaman and Nicobar Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain, who is accused of gang rape and sexual abuse. Narain approached the Sessions Court after the Supreme Court on Monday suggested he could "apply for anticipatory bail". Earlier, the Delhi High Court had granted Narain protection from arrest till October 28.

355.title: I went through really hard s**t trying to get pregnant: Jennifer Aniston on failed IVF
355.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston revealed that "she was trying to get pregnant" many years back. She said that she had "gone through really hard s**t" in her late 30s and 40s, adding, "All the years and years and years of speculation...It was really hard." "I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas... I was throwing everything at it," said Jennifer.

356.title: Congress will win unilaterally in Himachal Pradesh: Raj CM Gehlot
356.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that Congress would win unilaterally in the upcoming Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. Speaking after returning from the tour of Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat, Gehlot said, "There's a good atmosphere in Gujarat. There's also a very fierce wave against the BJP government." "Unemployment situation is very terrible in Gujarat," he added.

357.title: Good neighbours don't do terrorism: EAM Jaishankar on India-Pak ties
357.article_body: External affairs minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Thursday said, "The people of India want good neighbourly relations with Pakistan, as does the Government of India." "However, good neighbours do not carry out or condone terrorist activities. It's as simple as that," he added. Earlier, Jaishankar had described terrorism as "one of the gravest threats" to humanity during a UNSC meeting.

358.title: Centre's panel to review air pollution situation in Delhi-NCR tomorrow
358.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management on Thursday said it will review the situation in Delhi on Friday as air pollution levels have come down to the 'poor' category from 'very poor'. The panel may take a call on revoking restrictions in place in Delhi-NCR. All construction and demolition work, except for essential projects, is banned in the area.

359.title: We'll come back stronger: Ajay Devgn, Farhan Akhtar on India's T20 WC exit
359.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn penned a note on Instagram after India were knocked out of the T20 World Cup 2022 after a semi-final defeat against England. "Through thick and thin...we're here to stand with the best team in the world...We'll come back stronger," Ajay wrote. Farhan Akhtar wrote on Instagram, "Yes, it was a disappointing day...but the story doesn't end here."

360.title: TCS to expand in Illinois, create 1,200 additional jobs
360.article_body: IT services major Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Thursday announced that it plans to expand in Illinois by creating 1,200 new jobs by the end of 2024. Currently, it employs over 3,000 people in the US state, including 1,100 hired in the last five years. TCS plans to accelerate its outreach efforts to cover 25% more local students and teachers.

361.title: Myanmar man impersonates deceased Indian using his Aadhaar card, held
361.article_body: A 26-year-old Myanmar national was arrested in Manipur's Chandel district for allegedly impersonating a deceased Indian man and possessing an Aadhaar card in the latter's name, police said. The accused, Lenkhenmang Mate, was impersonating Holkholal who passed away in May 2019. Notably, the incident comes in the wake of a massive crackdown by police on illegal immigrants in the state.

362.title: SEBI issues new fee payment disclosure format under debt securities
362.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) issued a new format for disclosure of fee payment applicable under the issuance of debt securities rules, which will come into force with immediate effect. Under the new format, issuers who have listed or propose to list entities will have to disclose date of remittance and amount remitted, among other things.

363.title: India played role of troubleshooter during COVID-19 pandemic: Naqvi
363.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said India played the role of a troubleshooter during the COVID-19 pandemic and the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. India addressed the challenges with an aim to ensure health and prosperity for all, the former minister added. He stated that India-made COVID-19 vaccines aided many countries. Naqvi was addressing a conference on India-Iran bilateral relations.

364.title: There should be 1 leader, not 7: Ajay Jadeja on India's exit from T20 WC 2022
364.article_body: Referring to several players having captained India in T20I cricket this year, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said there should be just one leader and not seven as it could get difficult for the team. He added, "If you've to make a team as captain, you've to stick with the side for...year. How many series did Rohit Sharma play this year?"

365.title: Over 35,000 suspected cases of cholera reported in Syria so far
365.article_body: UNICEF has said that more than 35,000 suspected cases of cholera have been reported across Syria. Reportedly, poor access to safe water has exacerbated a cholera outbreak in Syria's war-battered provinces. According to the WHO, Syria's cases are linked to a rampaging outbreak that began in Afghanistan in June and then spread to Pakistan, Iran, Iraq, Syria and Lebanon.

366.title: It's getting harder for makers to bring people to theatres: Samantha
366.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu has said that it is getting harder for filmmakers to bring people to theatres. "[People] have all gotten used to waiting for the movies to hit the streaming platforms. And so as filmmakers and actors, we have been forced to rethink and rewrite," Samantha added. The actress will next feature in 'Yashoda'.

367.title: PM Modi to visit Indonesia from November 14-16 to attend G-20 summit
367.article_body: PM Narendra Modi is set to visit Indonesia's Bali from November 14 to 16 to attend the two-day G20 summit, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said on Thursday. India will assume the presidency of the grouping from the current chair Indonesia on December 1. Notably, India also recently unveiled the logo, theme and website for its presidency.

368.title: Certainly some people didn't want Pakistan-England final, better luck next time: Buttler
368.article_body: After defeating India in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, England captain Jos Buttler said, "Certainly some people were not wanting a Pakistan-England final." He added, "I know after looking at the first India-Pakistan game everyone wanted to see them again but better luck next time." England chased down 169-run target without losing a wicket.

369.title: Governor Arif Mohammed Khan removed as chancellor of Kerala university
369.article_body: The Kerala government on Thursday removed Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as chancellor of state university, Kerala Kalamandalam. The deemed-to-be university was set up for the preservation and promotion of the traditional performing arts of the state. Kerala Minister of Higher Education R Bindu earlier said that the decision was taken to improve higher education.

370.title: Gadar's Tara Singh was not about destroying pumps, shouting: Sunny Deol
370.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has said that his role of Tara Singh in the film 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha' was not about destroying pumps and shouting. "It was a family's struggle to fight divisive forces and be together. It had the ingredients of a great family film," he added. Sunny will feature in 'Gadar 2' alongside actress Ameesha Patel.

371.title: Congress can’t provide security, no reason to vote for them: UP CM Yogi in Himachal
371.article_body: During a public rally in Himachal Pradesh on Thursday, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath launched an attack on Congress and said there's no point to vote for them as Congress cannot provide security to people. "Could you imagine a...Ram temple in Ayodhya, abrogation of Article 370 or a 'Har Ghar Jal' scheme during a Congress government?" he added.

372.title: 48-yr-old man falls into pit dug for storm-water drain in TN, dies
372.article_body: A 48-year-old man, Lakshmipathi, died after falling into an under-construction storm-water drain in Tamil Nadu's Kancheepuram on Thursday. According to police, the deceased, a mechanic, tripped and fell into the pit around 5:30 am. As per initial investigation, the man was drunk when he fell into the pit, police said. After the local residents informed police, the body was recovered.

373.title: US inflation slowed to 7.7% in October over past 12 months
373.article_body: Consumer inflation in United States eased to 7.7% in October from a year earlier, the US Labor Department said on Thursday. This was the smallest 12-month increase since January 2022. On a monthly basis, inflation increased 0.4% in October. According to the data, food prices went up 10.9% year-over-year, while energy prices rose 17.6%.

374.title: Seeking capital raise, talked to Justin Sun: FTX CEO in a memo
374.article_body: After Binance cancelled its acquisition, FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried told staff in a memo that he was seeking a capital raise and had held talks with Justin Sun, Founder of the crypto token TRON, Reuters reported. In the memo, Bankman-Fried said for the next week he would be "conducting a raise" to do right by customers and "possible new investors".

375.title: Director's arrest no way linked to operations: Aurobindo Pharma
375.article_body: Aurobindo Pharma said that their Director Sarath Chandra Reddy's arrest was in no way related to the company or its subsidiaries' operations. Sarath Reddy and Benoy Babu of Pernod Ricard, a liquor company, were arrested by the Enforcement Directorate under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) for alleged involvement in the Delhi liquor policy scam.

376.title: Difficult to count the scams under Cong rule: Amit Shah in Himachal
376.article_body: At a rally in Himachal Pradesh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that it's difficult to keep count of scams under Congress, however, it's difficult to find scams since the BJP came to power. Talking about the "10 guarantees" promised by Congress, he added that people trust in the guarantees of those with reputation and the opposition party has none.

377.title: Adani Power to sell 100% stake in Support Properties to AdaniConneX
377.article_body: Adani Power said that it has entered into an MoU to sell its entire stake in Support Properties Private Ltd to AdaniConneX Private Ltd (ACX) for ₹1,556.5 crore. ACX is a 50:50 joint venture between Adani Enterprises Limited, which is a promoter group company, and EdgeConneX. A BSE filing said the proposed transaction is done on an arm’s length basis.

378.title: Deepika, SRK among the biggest pairings of Indian cinema: Siddharth
378.article_body: 'Pathaan' director Siddharth Anand has said that actor Shah Rukh Khan and actress Deepika Padukone are among the best pairs of Indian cinema. "They have electric chemistry with each other and they look just so hot together. It's rare to find a pairing like theirs and their jodi (pair) is a huge USP for Pathaan," the director added.

379.title: Apple announces $450 mn investment to enable emergency satellite texting
379.article_body: Apple on Thursday said that it will spend $450 million with US companies to enable its new Emergency SOS via Satellite on iPhone 14 models. Apple added that the majority of the funding will go to Globalstar that operates the satellites that make the feature possible. The new service will launch later this month in US and Canada.

380.title: SAT stays securities market ban on Bombay Dyeing, Nusli Wadia, his sons
380.article_body: The Securities Appellate Tribunal stayed a SEBI order that banned Bombay Dyeing and its promoters, Nusli N Wadia and his sons, from the securities market for two years for being involved in a fraudulent scheme of misrepresenting the company's financial statements. The matter would be listed for the next hearing on January 10, 2023, as per SAT's order.

381.title: Political campaigning in Himachal Pradesh ends
381.article_body: Campaigning for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections ended at 5 pm on Thursday. No political rallies or public meetings will now be allowed in the state before the polling ends on Saturday. PM Narendra Modi visited Himachal twice to campaign for the BJP. Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra also visited the state, while Rahul Gandhi skipped the campaigning.

382.title: BJP didn't deliver on promises made before 2017 civic polls: AAP's Atishi
382.article_body: AAP leader Atishi on Thursday claimed the BJP has not fulfilled its promises made ahead of 2017 civic polls in Delhi. "They didn't fulfil the promise of cleaning of markets during the night," Atishi said. The height of the mountains of garbage has only increased under MCD areas despite the BJP's promise to reduce waste from landfill sites, she added.

383.title: PM to visit K'taka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra and Telangana on Nov 11 & 12
383.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will visit Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana on November 11 and 12 and lay the foundation stone of projects worth over ₹25,000 crore. PM Modi will unveil a 108-feet-tall bronze statue of Nadaprabhu Kempegowda in Bengaluru. He will also inaugurate Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru and flag off Chennai-Mysuru Vande Bharat Express.

384.title: Why is BJP running around courts, if not involved: TRS on MLA poaching case
384.article_body: Telangana minister and TRS leader T Harish Rao asked why the BJP leaders are knocking on the courts' doors, if the party is not involved in MLA poaching case. "The BJP general secretary filed a petition in the court asking for a halt in the investigation," he said. "It shows that...BJP is scared of the truth coming out," he added.

385.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a movement to unite the country: Raut after meeting Pawar
385.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday met NCP chief Sharad Pawar a day after he was released on bail in an alleged money laundering case. "The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a movement to unite the country and end the atmosphere of bitterness. This should be welcomed,'' Raut said. He met Pawar to inquire about his health, he added.

386.title: How have Team India performed in ICC tournaments since winning Champions Trophy in 2013?
386.article_body: Since winning Champions Trophy in 2013, Team India have not won a single ICC trophy. India were finalists in T20 World Cup 2014 and crashed out of T20 World Cup in semi-finals in 2016 and 2022, while they were knocked out in group stage in 2021 edition. India lost in semi-finals in ODI World Cup in 2015 and 2019.

387.title: He messaged me saying you'll do good: Arjun on replacing Rannvijay on Splitsvilla
387.article_body: Arjun Bijlani has opened up about replacing Rannvijay Singha on the dating reality show Splitsvilla 14. "Rannvijay has hosted Splitsvilla for such a long time and has his own fan following. Hence, the comparisons are bound to happen," he said. "[Rannvijay] wished me. He messaged saying that you will do good, and that's how our equation is," Arjun added.

388.title: Pandya shares pics from T20 WC 2022 after India's exit, says 'Devastated, gutted, hurt'
388.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to share pictures from T20 World Cup 2022 following India's exit. "Devastated, gutted, hurt. Tough to take, for all of us. To my teammates...I've enjoyed the bond that we built...we fought for each other every step of the way," he wrote. He added, "It wasn't meant to be...but we'll reflect and keep fighting."

389.title: I f**ked up twice: FTX's 30-year-old CEO who lost billionaire status overnight
389.article_body: Crypto exchange FTX's 30-year-old CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, who lost his billionaire status overnight, tweeted, "I'm sorry...I f**ked up twice." He said, "Poor internal labelling of bank-related accounts meant that I was substantially off on my sense of users' margin," and also took the blame for "poor communication". This comes after Binance ended a deal to acquire FTX.

390.title: Parts of Himachal, Uttarakhand receive heavy snowfall; pics surface
390.article_body: The higher reaches of Himachal Pradesh received heavy snowfall on Thursday, while lower areas like Dharamshala and Palampur witnessed rainfall. Pictures from the state showed snow-covered streets in areas like Kaza and Koksar in Lahaul and Spiti district. Parts of Uttarakhand also received snowfall during the day. Visuals showed mountain peaks in Badrinath covered in a thick blanket of snow.

391.title: Vir Das releases video as show cancelled in B'luru, says 'I shouldn't be on the news'
391.article_body: Comedian Vir Das released a video after his show was cancelled in Bengaluru following objections from a right-wing group for alleged "derogatory remarks" against PM Narendra Modi and women. In the video, taken after one of his shows, he asked the audience, "Did we target any specific government or leader?" Das tweeted, "I'm an artist...I shouldn't be on the news."

392.title: Smriti Irani invokes 'Dayaben' from 'Taarak Mehta' after India's T20 WC exit
392.article_body: BJP leader Smriti Irani uploaded a snippet from the popular TV show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', where 'Daya Jethalal Gada' says her catchphrase "hey maa, mata ji". Captioning the video, Irani wrote, "When you galti se ask someone 'score kya hai?' (When you mistakenly ask someone 'what's the score?')" England defeated India by 10 wickets in the semi-final.

393.title: UP man, who had been rescuing snakes for 30 years, dies after cobra bite
393.article_body: A 60-year-old man, who had been rescuing snakes for last 30 years, died after being bitten by a cobra in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Tuesday. He was bitten on his right hand while catching the cobra from a house in Teachers' Colony. He had caught the snake safely but became relaxed while putting it into the rescue bag.

394.title: Bullet hits plane while it was landing in Beirut, creates hole in fuselage
394.article_body: A Middle East Airlines (MEA) passenger plane was hit by a stray bullet while it was landing in Beirut, MEA Chairman Mohamad El-Hout said. However, no injuries were reported to have been caused due to the incident. Meanwhile, Lebanese lawmaker Paula Yacoubian, who was on the flight, shared images on Twitter, appearing to show a hole in the plane's fuselage.

395.title: Coimbatore 'suicide bomber' had taken ISIS oath, planned to attack temple: NIA
395.article_body: The 29-year-old engineering student, who died in the Coimbatore car blast on October 23, had taken the ISIS oath and was planning to attack the Kottai Easwaran Temple, the investigation has revealed, claimed NIA officials. According to the officials, the accused had planned to damage the symbols of a particular religion intending to strike terror within the community.

396.title: Airing 30 mins of national interest content daily must for TV channels
396.article_body: Centre's revised guidelines for compliance for television channels have made it mandatory for them to air content deemed in national and public interest for 30 minutes every day. Channels can broadcast content on education, spread of literacy, agriculture and rural development, among other themes. The new guidelines reportedly do not apply to sports channels, which have been exempted.

397.title: Actor Sathish called out for commenting on Sunny Leone, Dharsha Gupta's clothes
397.article_body: Actor Sathish was called out for commenting on choice of clothes of his co-stars Dharsha Gupta and Sunny Leone at an event. He commented on Dharsha's crop top-lehenga by comparing it with Sunny Leone's saree. "To...ask...for mass heckling of a crowd by a man on a woman who doesn't dress according to culture. When will this behaviour...stop?" Chinmayi Sripada tweeted.

398.title: 12-yr-old girl killed by dumper truck on her way to school in UP
398.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was crushed to death by a dumper truck when she was on her way to school in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad on Thursday, police said. The girl was on a bicycle when the accident took place. Angry locals staged a protest at the spot and pelted stones at the stranded vehicles, police said.

399.title: Firearms being smuggled to separate North Bengal, says CM Banerjee
399.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday alleged firearms are being smuggled from Bihar and across international borders to separate North Bengal from the state. Banerjee further claimed that the vehicles of VIPs are being used for the purpose and directed the District Magistrates and Police Superintendents to look into the matter to put an end to such attempts.

400.title: Amagi raises $100 mn from General Atlantic, valuation reaches $1.4 bn
400.article_body: Media technology company Amagi has raised $100 million from private equity company General Atlantic valuing the company at $1.4 billion. Founded by Subramanian, Srinivasan KA and Srividhya Srinivasan in 2008, it was valued at $1 billion after its last funding in March 2022. Amagi also announced that it crossed $100 million in annual recurring revenue after a record July-September quarter.
